FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'FAIR VALUE OF FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     The carrying amounts of the Company's financial instruments as of December\n", b'28, 1997 approximate market values based upon the following methods and\n', b'assumptions:\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS--The carrying amount of cash and cash\n', b'equivalents is assumed to approximate fair value as cash equivalents include\n', b'all highly liquid, short-term investments with original maturities of three\n', b'months or less.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     SHORT AND LONG TERM DEBT--The carrying value of the Company's various debt\n", b'outstanding as of December 28, 1997 approximates market. The fair value of the\n', b"Company's fixed rate debt is estimated using discounted cash flow analysis,\n", b'based upon the market yield of public debt securities of comparable credit\n', b"quality and maturity. The carrying value of the Company's variable rate debt is\n", b'assumed to approximate market based upon periodic adjustments of the interest\n', b'rate to the current market rate in accordance with the terms of the debt\n', b'agreements.\n', b'\n', b'                                      F-13\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                     SUNBEAM CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES\n', b'\n', b'            NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'4. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'     LETTERS OF CREDIT--The Company utilizes stand-by letters of credit to back\n', b'certain financing instruments and insurance policies and commercial letters of\n', b'credit guaranteeing various international trade activities. The contract\n', b'amounts of the letters of credit approximate their fair value.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'DERIVATIVE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company selectively uses derivatives to manage interest rate and\n', b'foreign exchange exposures that arise in the normal course of business. The use\n', b"of derivatives did not have a material impact on the Company's results of\n", b'operations in 1997, 1996 and 1995. No derivatives are entered into for trading\n', b'or speculative purposes. Foreign exchange option and forward contracts are used\n', b"to hedge a portion of the Company's underlying exposures denominated in foreign\n", b'currency. Although the market value of derivative contracts at any single point\n', b'in time will vary with changes in interest and/or foreign exchange rates, the\n', b'difference between the carrying value and fair value of such contracts at\n', b'December 29, 1996 and December 31, 1995 is not considered to be material,\n', b'either individually or in the aggregate. The Company had no derivative\n', b'financial instruments outstanding at December 28, 1997. The Company enters into\n', b'derivative contracts with counterparties that it believes to be creditworthy.\n', b'The Company does not enter into any leveraged derivative transactions.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     As of December 28, 1996, $10.0 million of the Company's outstanding\n", b'floating rate debt was subject to interest rate swap agreements.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     In order to mitigate the transaction exposures that may arise from changes\n', b'in foreign exchange rates, the Company purchases foreign currency option\n', b'contracts to hedge anticipated transactions. The option contracts typically\n', b'expire within one year. Any realized gains on options are not deferred but are\n', b'recognized in income in the period when the hedged exposure is recognized. The\n', b'Company purchased options with a notional value of $16.6 million in 1997, $18.2\n', b'million in 1996 and $11.7 million in 1995. Options with notional value of $17.9\n', b'million, $25.4 million and $3.2 million expired in 1997, 1996 and 1995,\n', b'respectively. The Company held purchased option contracts with a notional value\n', b'of $1.4 million at December 29, 1996.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'5. EMPLOYEE STOCK OPTIONS AND AWARDS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company has one stock-based compensation plan, the Amended and\n', b'Restated Sunbeam Corporation Stock Option Plan (the "Plan"). RESTRUCTURING, IMPAIRMENT AND OTHER COSTS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     In November 1996, the Company announced the details of its restructuring\n', b'and growth plan. The cost reduction phase of the plan included the\n', b'consolidation of administrative functions within the Company, the\n', b'rationalization of manufacturing and warehouse facilities, the centralization\n', b"of the Company's procurement function, and reduction of the Company's product\n", b'offerings and stock keeping units ("SKU\'s"). The Company also announced plans\n', b'to divest several lines of business which it determined are not core for\n', b'Sunbeam (see Note 9).\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     In connection with the restructuring plan, the Company consolidated six\n', b'divisional and regional headquarters functions into a single worldwide\n', b'corporate headquarters in Delray Beach, Florida and outsourced certain back\n', b'office activities resulting in a 50% reduction in total\n', b'back-office/administrative headcount. Overall, the restructuring plan calls for\n', b'a reduction in the number of production facilities from 26 to 8 and the\n', b"elimination of over 6,000 positions from the Company's workforce, including\n", b'3,300 from the disposition of non-core business operations and the elimination\n', b'of approximately 2,800 other positions. The Company completed the major phases\n', b'of the restructuring plan by January 1997.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     In conjunction with the implementation of the restructuring and growth\n', b'plan, the Company recorded a pre-tax special charge to earnings of\n', b'approximately $337.6 million in the fourth quarter of 1996. This amount is\n', b'allocated as follows in the accompanying Consolidated Statement of Operations:\n', b'$154.9 million to Restructuring, Impairment and Other Costs as further\n', b'described below; $92.3 million to Cost of Goods Sold related principally to\n', b"inventory write-downs from the reduction in SKU's and costs of inventory\n", b'liquidation programs; $42.5 million to Selling, General and Administrative\n', b'expenses principally for increases in environmental and litigation reserves\n', b'(see Note 12) and other reserve categories; and the estimated pre-tax loss on\n', b"the divestiture of the Company's furniture business of approximately $47.9\n", b'million. During the first quarter of 1997, upon completion of the sale, the\n', b'Company provided for additional losses on the disposal of the furniture\n', b'business of $13.7 million, net of applicable income tax benefits as a result of\n', b'lower than anticipated sales proceeds.\n', b'\n', b'                                      F-21\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                     SUNBEAM CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES\n', b'\n', b'            NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'8. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'ENVIRONMENTAL MATTERS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     The Company's operations, like those of comparable businesses, are subject\n", b'to certain federal, state, local and foreign environmental laws and\n', b'regulations. As of December 28, 1997, the Company had been identified as a\n', b'potentially responsible party ("PRP") in connection with seven sites subject to\n', b'the federal Superfund law and two sites subject to state Superfund laws\n', b'comparable to the federal law (collectively the "Environmental Sites"),\n', b'exclusive of sites at which the Company has been designated (or expects to be\n', b'designated) as a de minimis (less than 1%) participant. Substantially all of\n', b'these sites relate to divested operations of the Company.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company currently is engaged in active remediation activities at nine\n', b'sites, four of which are among the Environmental Sites referred to above, and\n', b'five of which have not been designated as Superfund sites under federal or\n', b'state law. In addition, the Company is engaged in environmental remediation\n', b'activities at a site in Newburgh Heights, Ohio, where a subsidiary formerly\n', b'conducted\n', b'\n', b'                                      F-25\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                     SUNBEAM CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES\n', b'\n', b'            NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'12. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'operations. The Company has been actively cooperating with the United States\n', b'Nuclear Regulatory Commission and state regulatory authorities in developing a\n', b'plan for remediation of this site; which remediation is expected to be\n', b'substantially completed during 1998.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company has established reserves, in accordance with SFAS No. 5,\n', b'Accounting for Contingencies, to cover the anticipated probable costs of\n', b'remediation, based upon periodic reviews of all sites for which the Company\n', b'has, or may have remediation responsibility. As of December 28, 1997, the\n', b"amount of such reserves was less than 5% of the Company's total liabilities as\n", b'set forth in the consolidated financial statements. Liability under the\n', b'Superfund law is joint and several and is imposed on a strict basis, without\n', b'regard to degree of negligence or culpability. As a result, the Company\n', b"recognizes its responsibility to determine whether other PRP's at a Superfund\n", b'site are financially capable of paying their respective shares of the ultimate\n', b'cost of remediation of the site. Whenever the Company has determined that a\n', b'particular PRP is not financially responsible, it has assumed for purposes of\n', b'establishing reserve amounts that such PRP will not pay its respective share of\n', b"the costs of remediation. To minimize the Company's potential liability with\n", b'respect to the Environmental Sites, the Company has actively participated in\n', b"steering committees and other groups of PRP's established with respect to such\n", b'sites. The Company continues to pursue the recovery of some environmental\n', b'remediation costs from certain of its liability insurance carriers; however,\n', b'such potential recoveries have not been offset against potential liabilities\n', b"and have not been considered in determining the Company's environmental\n", b'reserves.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     Due to uncertainty over remedial measures to be adopted at some sites, the\n', b'possibility of changes in environmental laws and regulations and the fact that\n', b'joint and several liability with the right of contribution is possible at\n', b"federal and state Superfund sites, the Company's ultimate future liability with\n", b'respect to sites at which remediation has not been completed may vary from the\n', b"amounts reserved as of December 28, 1997. In connection with the Company's\n", b'restructuring plan, in the fourth quarter of 1996 a comprehensive review of all\n', b'environmental exposures was performed, and the Company accelerated its strategy\n', b'for the resolution and settlement of certain environmental claims. As a result,\n', b'the Company recorded additional environmental reserves of approximately $9.0\n', b'million in the fourth quarter of 1996. The Company believes, based on existing\n', b'information, that the costs of completing environmental remediation of all\n', b'sites for which the Company has a remediation responsibility have been\n', b'adequately reserved, and that the ultimate resolution of these matters will not\n', b"have a material adverse effect upon the Company's financial condition.\n", b'\n', b'\n', b'LEASES\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company rents certain facilities, equipment and retail stores under\n', b'operating leases. Rental expense for operating leases amounted to $7.4 million\n', b'in 1997, $8.0 million for 1996 and $8.6 million for 1995. The minimum future\n', b'rentals due under noncancelable operating leases as of December 28, 1997\n', b'aggregated $30.9 million. The amounts payable in each of the years 1998-2002 and\n', b'thereafter are $4.8 million, $4.6 million, $4.2 million, $3.9 million, $3.4\n', b'million and $10.0 million, respectively.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'CERTAIN DEBT OBLIGATIONS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     Responsibility for servicing certain debt obligations of the Company's\n", b'predecessor were assumed by third parties in connection with the acquisition of\n', b"former businesses, although the Company's predecessor remained the primary\n", b'obligor in accordance with the respective loan documents. Such\n', b'\n', b'                                      F-26\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                     SUNBEAM CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES\n', b'\n', b'            NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'12. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES--(CONTINUED)\n', b'\n', b'obligations, which amounted to approximately $19.0 million at December 28,\n', b'1997, and the corresponding receivables from the third parties, are not\n', b'included in the consolidated balance sheets since these transactions occurred\n', b'prior to the issuance of SFAS No. 76, Extinguishment of Debt. Management\n', b'believes that the third parties will continue to meet their obligations\n', b'pursuant to the assumption agreements.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     Letters of credit aggregating $28.6 million were outstanding as of\n', b'December 28, 1997.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'LITIGATION\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company is involved in various lawsuits arising from time to time in\n', b'the ordinary course of business or and related to divested operations of the\n', b'Company. The Company has established reserves, in accordance with SFAS No. 5,\n', b'Accounting for Contingencies, to cover the anticipated probable costs of\n', b'litigation matters, based upon periodic reviews of all cases.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company believes, based on existing information, that anticipated\n', b'probable costs of litigation matters have been adequately reserved, and that\n', b'the ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material adverse\n', b"effect upon the Company's financial condition.\n", b'\n', b'\n', b'PRODUCT LIABILITY MATTERS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The Company is party to various personal injury and property damage\n', b'lawsuits relating to its products and incidental to its business. Annually, the\n', b"Company sets its product liability insurance program based on the Company's\n", b'current and historical claims experience and the availability and cost of\n', b"insurance. The Company's program for 1997 was comprised of a self-insurance\n", b'retention of $1 million per occurrence.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     Cumulative amounts estimated to be payable by the Company with respect to\n', b'pending and potential claims for all years in which the Company is liable under\n', b'its self-insurance retention have been accrued as liabilities. Such accrued\n', b'liabilities are necessarily based on estimates (which include actuarial\n', b'determinations made by independent actuarial consultants as to liability\n', b'exposure, taking into account prior experience, numbers of claims and other\n', b"relevant factors); thus, the Company's ultimate liability may exceed or be less\n", b'than the amounts accrued. The methods of making such estimates and establishing\n', b'the resulting liability are reviewed continually and any adjustments resulting\n', b'therefrom are reflected in current operating results.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     Historically, product liability awards have rarely exceeded the Company's\n", b'individual per occurrence self-insured retention. There can be no assurance,\n', b"however, that the Company's future product liability experience will be\n", b'consistent with its past experience. Based on existing information, the Company\n', b'believes that the ultimate conclusion of the various pending product liability\n', b'claims and lawsuits of the Company, individually or in the aggregate, will not\n', b'have a materially adverse effect on the financial position or results of\n', b'operations of the Company.\n', b'\n', b'                                      F-27\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                     SUNBEAM CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES\n', b'\n', b'            NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS--(CONTINUED)\n', b'13. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS\n', b'\n', b'NEW EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     On February 20, 1998 the Company entered into new three-year employment\n', b'agreements with its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and two other senior\n', b'officers of the Company. These agreements replaced previous employment\n', b'agreements entered into in July 1996 that were scheduled to expire in July\n', b'1999.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"     The new employment agreement for the Company's Chairman provides for,\n", b'among other items, the acceleration of vesting of 200,000 shares of restricted\n', b'stock and the forfeiture of the remaining 133,333 shares of unvested restricted\n', b'stock granted under the July 1996 agreement as further described in Note 2, a\n', b'new equity grant of 300,000 shares of unrestricted stock, a new grant of a\n', b"ten-year option to purchase 3,750,000 shares of the Company's common stock with\n", b'an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the stock at the date of\n', b'grant and exercisable in three equal annual installments beginning on the date\n', b'of grant and the acceleration of vesting of 833,333 outstanding stock options\n', b'granted under the July 1996 agreement as further described in Note 5. In\n', b'addition, the new employment agreement with the Chairman and Chief Executive\n', b'Officer provides for tax gross-ups with respect to any tax assessed on the\n', b'equity grant and acceleration of vesting of restricted stock.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The new employment agreements with the two other senior officers provide\n', b'for, among other items, the grant of a total of 180,000 shares of restricted\n', b'stock that vest in four equal annual installments beginning the date of grant,\n', b'the acceleration of vesting of 44,000 shares of restricted stock and the\n', b'forfeiture of the remaining 29,332 shares of unvested restricted stock granted\n', b'under the July 1996 agreements, new grants of ten-year options to purchase a\n', b"total of 1,875,000 shares of the Company's common stock with an exercise price\n", b'equal to the fair market value of the stock at the date of grant and\n', b'exercisable in four equal annual installments beginning on the date of grant\n', b'and the acceleration of vesting of 383,334 outstanding stock options granted\n', b'under the July 1996 agreements. In addition, the new employment agreements\n', b'provide for tax gross-ups with respect to any tax assessed on the restricted\n', b'stock grants and acceleration of vesting of restricted stock.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     Compensation expense attributed to the equity grant, the acceleration of\n', b'vesting of restricted stock and the related tax gross-ups will be recognized in\n', b'the first quarter of 1998 and compensation expense related to the new\n', b'restricted stock grants and related tax gross-ups will be amortized to expense\n', b'beginning in the first quarter of 1998 over the period in which the\n', b'restrictions lapse. Total after-tax compensation expense to be recognized in\n', b'the first quarter of 1998 related to these items is expected to be\n', b'approximately $30.0 million.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'PENDING ACQUISITIONS\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     On March 2, 1998, the Company announced the signing of three definitive\n', b'agreements to acquire The Coleman Company, Inc., Signature Brands USA, Inc. and\n', b'First Alert, Inc., Completion of the acquisitions, which is expected in the\n', b'second quarter of 1998, is contingent on customary conditions, including\n', b'regulatory approvals, and acquisition financings. Each of the acquisitions will\n', b'be accounted for under the purchase method, whereby the purchase price will be\n', b'allocated to the underlying assets acquired and liabilities assumed based upon\n', b'their estimated fair values.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The acquisition of The Coleman Company, Inc., the global leader in outdoor\n', b'recreational and hardware products is valued at approximately $2.0 billion,\n', b"consisting of the Company's common stock valued at approximately $811 million,\n", b'cash of approximately $260 million and assumed debt. Shareholders of The Coleman\n', b"Company, Inc. will receive $6.44 in cash and .5677 shares of the Company's stock\n", b'for each share of Coleman stock.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The acquisition of Signature Brands USA, Inc., the North American leader in\n', b'coffeemakers marketed under the Mr. Coffee/registered trademark/ brand name and\n', b'a leader in consumer health products marketed under the Health O\n', b'Meter/registered trademark/ brand is valued at approximately $250 million,\n', b'consisting of cash of $8.25 per share of Signature Brand common stock and the\n', b'assumption of existing debt.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'     The acquisition of First Alert, Inc., the worldwide leader in residential\n', b'safety equipment, including smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors is\n', b'valued at approximately $175 million, consisting of cash of $5.25 per share of\n', b'First Alert common stock and the assumption of existing debt. \n', b'\n', b'     The Company plans on refinancing               EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT\n', b'\n', b'                  AGREEMENT, effective as of February 1, 1998 (the "Effective\n', b'Date"), and executed on February 20, 1998 (the "Execution Date"), by and between\n', b'ALBERT J. DUNLAP (the "Executive") and SUNBEAM CORPORATION, a Delaware\n', b'corporation (the "Company").\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the Executive is a party to the Employment Agreement\n', b'with the Company dated as of July 18, 1996 (the "Prior Agreement"):\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the Board of Directors of the Company (the "Board")\n', b'desires to continue to employ the Executive and the Executive desires to\n', b'continue to furnish services to the Company on the terms and conditions\n', b'hereinafter set forth;\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the parties desire to enter into this Agreement\n', b'setting forth the terms and conditions of the employment relationship of the\n', b'Executive with the Company; and\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the parties desire to provide for the termination of\n', b'the Prior Agreement, effective upon the Effective Date;\n', b'\n', b'                  NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the\n', b'mutual agreements set forth below, the parties hereby agree as follows:\n', b'\n', b'                  1. EMPLOYMENT. The Company hereby agrees to employ the\n', b'Executive, and the Executive hereby accepts such employment, on the terms and\n', b'conditions hereinafter set forth.\n', b'\n', b'                  2. EMPLOYMENT PERIOD. The period of employment of the\n', b'Executive by the Company hereunder (the "Employment Period") shall commence as\n', b'of the Effective Date and shall end on January 31, 2001 (or the Date of\n', b'Termination (as defined in Section 6 below), if earlier). All options awards\n', b'granted pursuant to the Prior Agreement shall vest and become exercisable in\n', b'full as of the Execution Date. In addition, 40% of the restricted stock granted\n', b'pursuant to the Prior Agreement which is subject to restrictions immediately\n', b'prior\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'to the Execution Date shall be forfeited as of the Execution Date, and the\n', b'remaining shares of such restricted stock shall become vested in full as of the\n', b'Execution Date and the Company shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up\n', b'basis for any federal income tax assessed upon him upon the vesting of such\n', b'restricted stock. Commencing on February 1, 2001, the Employment Period shall be\n', b'extended for successive one year periods (individually, a "Renewal Period"),\n', b'unless a notice not to extend this Agreement shall have been given by either\n', b'party hereto to the other not later than August 1 immediately preceding the\n', b'commencement of a Renewal Period or unless the Date of Termination shall have\n', b'previously occurred; provided, however, that the last such Renewal Period shall\n', b'be the Renewal Period ending on January 31, 2003. Unless the context suggests\n', b'otherwise, the Employment Period hereunder shall for all purposes of this\n', b'Agreement be deemed to include any Renewal Period.\n', b'\n', b'                  3. POSITION AND DUTIES. The Executive shall serve as Chairman\n', b'of the Board and Chief Executive Officer and as a director of the Company and\n', b'shall report directly to the Board. During the Employment Period, subject to the\n', b'supervisory powers of the Board, the Executive shall have those powers and\n', b'duties consistent with his position as Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive\n', b'Officer, which powers shall in all cases include, without limitation, the power\n', b'of supervision and control over and responsibility for the general management\n', b'and operation of the Company. The Executive agrees to devote substantially all\n', b'his working time, attention and energies to the performance of his duties for\n', b'the Company. It shall not be a violation of this Agreement for the Executive to\n', b'(i) serve on corporate, civic or charitable boards or committees, (ii) give\n', b'speeches and make media appearances to discuss matters of public interest and\n', b'(iii) manage his personal investments, so long as such activities do not\n', b"unreasonably interfere with the performance of the Executive's responsibilities\n", b'as an officer of the Company in accordance with this Agreement. It is understood\n', b'that the Executive has made a commitment to appear in various cities in the\n', b'United States in connection with a book entitled Mean Business, of which he is a\n', b'co-author, and it shall not be a violation of this Agreement for the Executive\n', b'to make such appearances (the expenses relating to such appearances to be borne\n', b'by the Executive). The Company shall nominate the Executive as a director of the\n', b'Company and shall use its best efforts to have the Executive elected and\n', b'reelected to the Board for the duration of the Employment Period. The Company\n', b'shall also use its best efforts to cause three individuals, designated by the\n', b'Executive to be elected and reelected as directors of the Company for the\n', b'duration of the Employment Period. In the event that any of such individuals\n', b'fails to qualify or be elected (or, having been elected, resigns, is removed or\n', b'fails to be re-elected) during the Employment\n', b'\n', b'                                        2\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'Period, the Executive shall designate a successor reasonably acceptable to the\n', b'Board and the Company shall nominate such person as a director and shall use its\n', b'best efforts to cause such person to be elected and reelected.\n', b'\n', b'                  4. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE. The principal place of employment of\n', b"the Executive shall be at the Company's principal executive offices in Palm\n", b'Beach County, Florida, or such other location as may be agreed to by the Board\n', b"and the Executive. In the event that the Company's principal executive offices\n", b'are moved from Palm Beach County, Florida, the Company shall promptly pay, or\n', b'reimburse the Executive for, all reasonable expenses incurred by the Executive\n', b"for a period of one year relating to any change of the Executive's residence\n", b'from Boca Raton, Florida, in connection with his employment hereunder,\n', b'including, without limitation, reasonable expenses for himself and his family of\n', b'travel, moving, storage and suitable lodging and maintenance, and the Company\n', b'shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up basis in the event that any tax is\n', b'assessed upon him in relation to any such expenses. The Company shall pay or\n', b'reimburse the Executive for all reasonable costs and expenses of residential\n', b'relocation incurred by him for a period of one year in connection with each and\n', b'every additional change, if any, in the location of the principal executive\n', b'offices of the Company, and the Executive shall be reimbursed by the Company on\n', b'a grossed up basis in the event that any tax is assessed upon him in relation to\n', b'any such costs or expenses.\n', b'\n', b'                  5. COMPENSATION AND RELATED MATTERS.\n', b'\n', b'                           (a) BASE SALARY. As compensation for the performance\n', b'by the Executive of his duties hereunder, during the Employment Period the\n', b'Company shall pay the Executive a base salary at an annual rate of $2,000,000,\n', b'which rate shall be retroactive to the Effective Date (the base salary, at the\n', b'rate in effect from time to time, is hereinafter referred to as the "Base\n', b'Salary"). Except for the adjustment necessary to implement the retroactive\n', b'increase in Base Salary described in the immediately preceding sentence, the\n', b'Base Salary shall be payable in equal semi-monthly installments and may be\n', b"increased from time to time at the discretion of the Company's Compensation\n", b'Committee (or any successor thereof) and the Board. Base Salary shall not be\n', b'reduced after any increase thereof.\n', b'\n', b'                           (b) EQUITY GRANTS.\n', b'\n', b'                  (1) SHARES. Effective as of the Execution Date, the Executive\n', b'is hereby granted, without cost to the Executive, 300,000 shares (the "Shares")\n', b'of the\n', b'\n', b'                                        3\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b"Company's Common Stock, on the terms and conditions set forth herein. Such\n", b'shares shall be fully vested upon the Execution Date. All such Shares, shall be\n', b'the sole property of the Executive, shall be unrestricted and shall be freely\n', b'tradeable by the Executive, subject to applicable legal restrictions. Within six\n', b'(6) months after the Effective Date, the Company shall cause all such Shares to\n', b'be registered or qualified for resale under the Securities Act of 1933 and\n', b'applicable state laws. The Company shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up\n', b'basis with respect to any tax assessed upon him upon the grant of the Shares.\n', b'\n', b'                  (i) RIGHTS AS A STOCKHOLDER. Unless and until\n', b'         registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, certificates\n', b'         evidencing the Shares and shares acquired pursuant to the exercise of\n', b'         the Option (as defined in Section 5(b)(2) below) shall bear the\n', b'         following legend:\n', b'\n', b'                  THE SHARES EVIDENCED BY THIS CERTIFICATE MAY NOT BE SOLD,\n', b'                  TRANSFERRED, PLEDGED, HYPOTHECATED OR OTHERWISE DISPOSED OF\n', b'                  UNLESS REGISTERED UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS\n', b'                  AMENDED, OR UNLESS, IN THE OPINION OF COUNSEL FOR THE COMPANY,\n', b'                  SUCH REGISTRATION IS NOT REQUIRED.\n', b'\n', b'                  (2) STOCK OPTION. Effective as of the Effective Date, subject\n', b"to shareholder approval by Company's shareholders at the annual meeting to be\n", b'held on May 12, 1998 (or on such other date on which such meeting will be held)\n', b'(the "Annual Meeting"), the Executive is hereby granted a non-qualified stock\n', b'option (the "Option") to purchase 3,750,000 shares of Common Stock (the "Option\n', b'Award"). The Option Award is subject to the following conditions: (i) the\n', b'exercise price per share of Common Stock shall be $36.85 per share, which is the\n', b'average of the high and low selling price per share on the NYSE on January 30,\n', b'\n', b'                                        4\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'1998, (ii) the Option Award shall vest and become exercisable with respect to\n', b'one-third (1/3) of the shares of Common Stock subject to such award on the\n', b'Effective Date and, an additional one-third (1/3) of the shares of Common Stock\n', b'subject to such award, on each of the first and second anniversaries of the\n', b'Effective Date (subject to earlier vesting provisions set forth in Section\n', b'5(b)(3) and earlier vesting and forfeiture provisions set forth in Section 7),\n', b'and (iii) the Option Award shall expire on the tenth anniversary of the\n', b'Effective Date, subject to earlier termination as provided herein. GROSS-UP FOR EXCISE TAX. In the event that the Executive\n', b'receives any payment or benefit (including but not limited to the payments or\n', b'\n', b'                                       13\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'benefits pursuant to Section 7 of this Agreement) (a "Payment") that is subject\n', b'to the excise tax (the "Excise Tax") under Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue\n', b'Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code"), the Company shall pay to the Executive,\n', b'as soon thereafter as practicable, an additional amount (a "Gross-Up Payment")\n', b'such that the net amount retained by the Executive, after deduction of any\n', b'Excise Tax imposed upon the Payment and any federal, state and local income tax\n', b'and Excise Tax imposed upon the Gross-Up Payment shall be equal to the Payment.\n', b'The determination of whether an Excise Tax is due in respect of any payment or\n', b'benefit, the amount of the Excise Tax and the amount of the Gross-Up Payment\n', b'shall be made by an independent auditor (the "Auditor") jointly selected by the\n', b'Company and the Executive and paid by the Company. If the Executive and the\n', b'Company cannot agree on the firm to serve as the Auditor, then the Executive and\n', b'the Company shall each select one nationally recognized accounting firm and\n', b'those two firms shall jointly select the nationally recognized accounting firm\n', b'to serve as the Auditor. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for purposes of\n', b'determining the Gross-Up Payment in respect of any Payment, (i) any other\n', b'payments or benefits received or to be received by the Executive in connection\n', b"with a Change in Control or the Executive's termination of employment (whether\n", b'pursuant to the terms of this Agreement or any other plan, arrangement or\n', b'agreement with the Company, any person whose actions result in a Change in\n', b'Control or any person affiliated with the Company or such person) shall be\n', b'treated as "parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 280G(b)(2) of the\n', b'Code, and all "excess parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 280G of\n', b'the Code shall be treated as subject to the Excise Tax, unless in the opinion of\n', b'tax counsel selected by the Auditor, such other payments or benefits (in whole\n', b'or in part) do not constitute parachute payments, or are otherwise not subject\n', b'to the Excise Tax, and (ii) the Executive shall be deemed to pay federal income\n', b'tax at the highest marginal rate applicable in the calendar year in which the\n', b'Gross-Up Payment is made, and state and local income taxes at the highest\n', b"marginal rate of taxation in the state and locality of the Executive's residence\n", b'on the Date of Termination, net of the maximum reduction in federal income taxes\n', b'which could be obtained from deduction of such state and local taxes. In the\n', b'event the actual Excise Tax or such income tax is more or less than the amount\n', b'used to calculate the Gross-Up Payment, the Executive or the Company, as the\n', b'case may be, shall pay to the other an amount reflecting the actual Excise Tax\n', b'or such income tax, plus interest on the amount of such repayment at the rate\n', b'provided in Section 1274(b)(2)(B) of the Code.\n', b'\n', b'                  9. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, REMOVAL OF DOCUMENTS,\n', b'NON-COMPETITION.\n', b'\n', b'                           (a) CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. Except as may be required or appropriate in connection with his\n', b'carrying out his duties under this Agreement, the Executive shall not, without\n', b'the prior written consent of the Company or as may otherwise be required by law\n', b'or legal process, communicate or divulge any such Confidential Information to\n', b'anyone other than the Company and those designated by the Company.\n', b'\n', b'                           (b) REMOVAL OF DOCUMENTS. All records, files,\n', b'drawings, documents, models, and the like relating to the business of the\n', b'Sunbeam Entities, which the Executive prepares, uses or comes into contact with\n', b'and which contain Confidential Information shall not be removed by the Executive\n', b'from the premises of any Sunbeam Entity (without the written consent of the\n', b'Company) during or after the Employment Period unless such removal shall be\n', b'required or appropriate in connection with his carrying out his duties under\n', b'this Agreement, and, if so removed by the Executive, shall be returned to such\n', b"Sunbeam Entity immediately upon termination of the Executive's employment\n", b'hereunder.\n', b'\n', b"                           (c) NON-COMPETITION. During (i) the Executive's\n", b'employment with the Company and (ii) the two (2) year period immediately\n', b'following\n', b'\n', b'                                       15\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b"the Executive's Date of Termination, the Executive (A) shall not engage,\n", b'anywhere within the geographical areas in which any Sunbeam Entity is then\n', b'conducting its business operations, directly or indirectly, alone, in\n', b'association with or as a shareholder, principal, agent, partner, officer,\n', b'director, employee or consultant of any other organization, in any business (a\n', b'"Competitive Business") which competes with any business then being conducted by\n', b'such Sunbeam Entity; (B) shall not solicit or encourage any officer, employee or\n', b'consultant of any of the Sunbeam Entities to leave the employ of any of the\n', b'Sunbeam Entities for employment by or with any Competitive Business; and (C)\n', b'shall not solicit, divert or take away, or attempt to divert or to take away,\n', b'the business or patronage of any of the customers or accounts, or prospective\n', b'customers or accounts, of any Sunbeam Entity, which were contacted, solicited or\n', b'served by the Executive while employed by the Company; provided, however, that\n', b'nothing herein shall prohibit the Executive from owning a maximum of two percent\n', b'(2%) of the outstanding stock of any publicly traded corporation. Following the\n', b'Date of Termination, ownership by the Executive of not more than five percent\n', b'(5%) of any publicly traded corporation shall not constitute a violation hereof.\n', b'If, at any time, the provisions of this Section 10(c) shall be determined to be\n', b'invalid or unenforceable, by reason of being vague or unreasonable as to area,\n', b'duration or scope of activity, this Section 10(c) shall be considered divisible\n', b'and shall become and be immediately amended to only such area, duration and\n', b'scope of activity as shall be determined to be reasonable and enforceable by the\n', b'court or other body having jurisdiction over the matter; and the Executive\n', b'agrees that this Section 10(c) as so amended shall be valid and binding as\n', b'though any invalid or unenforceable provision had not been included herein. For\n', b'purposes of this Section 10(c), the design, manufacture and marketing of outdoor\n', b'barbecue grills and small kitchen appliances shall be construed to be a\n', b'Competitive Business; provided, however, that the gross revenues derived from\n', b'sales of such products by such competitor are greater than the lesser of (i) 10%\n', b'of its total revenues and (ii) $500,000,000.\n', b'\n', b'                           (d) REMEDIES. TERMINATION. The Executive's employment hereunder, as the case may be, may\n", b'be terminated as follows:\n', b'\n', b'                                         5\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b"        (a) DEATH. If, as a result of the Executive's incapacity due to\n", b'physical or mental illness, the Executive shall have been absent from his duties\n', b'hereunder on a full-time basis for one hundred and twenty (120) consecutive days\n', b'and, within thirty (30) days after written Notice of Termination (as defined in\n', b'Section 10(g) hereof), shall not have returned to the performance of his duties\n', b'hereunder on a full-time basis ("Disability"), the Company may terminate the\n', b"Executive's employment hereunder. The Company may terminate the Executive's employment\n", b'hereunder for Cause. For purposes of this Agreement, the Company shall have\n', b'"Cause" to terminate the Executive\'s employment hereunder:\n', b'\n', b"                      (i) upon the Executive's conviction for the commission of\n", b'        a felony (or a plea of nolo contendere thereto); or\n', b'\n', b'                      (ii) willful failure by the Executive substantially to\n', b'        perform his duties hereunder (other than any such failure resulting from\n', b"        the Executive's incapacity due to Disability).\n", b'\n', b'            For purposes hereof, no act or failure to act by the Executive shall\n', b'be considered "willful" unless done or omitted to be done by him not in good\n', b'faith or without reasonable belief that his action or omission was in the best\n', b'interests of the Company or contrary to written instructions of the Chief\n', b'Executive Officer or the Board of Directors. and\n', b'\n', b'                      (iii) the portion of the Restricted Shares that have not\n', b'        vested as of the Date of Termination equal to the number of such\n', b'        unvested Restricted Shares multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of\n', b'        which is 36 minus the number of full months remaining in the Employment\n', b'        Period (disregarding the earlier termination thereof) after the Date of\n', b'        Termination and denominator of which is 36, shall become vested as of\n', b'        the Date of Termination and the restrictions imposed thereon shall\n', b'        lapse. GROSS-UP FOR EXCISE TAX. In the event that the Executive receives any\n', b'payment or benefit (including but not limited to the payments or benefits\n', b'pursuant to Section 11 of this Agreement) (a "Payment") that is subject to the\n', b'excise tax (the "Excise Tax") under Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code of\n', b'1986, as amended (the "Code"), the Company shall pay to the Executive, as soon\n', b'thereafter as practicable, an additional amount (a "Gross-Up Payment") such that\n', b'the net amount retained by the Executive, after deduction of any Excise Tax\n', b'imposed upon the Payment and any federal, state and local income tax and Excise\n', b'Tax imposed upon the Gross-Up Payment shall be equal to the Payment. The\n', b'determination of whether an Excise Tax is due in respect of any payment or\n', b'benefit, the amount of the Excise Tax and the amount of the Gross-Up Payment\n', b'shall be made by an independent auditor (the "Auditor") jointly selected by the\n', b'Company and the Executive and paid by the Company. If the Executive and the\n', b'Company cannot agree on the firm to serve as the Auditor, then the Executive and\n', b'the Company shall each select one nationally recognized accounting firm and\n', b'those two firms shall jointly select the nationally recognized accounting firm\n', b'to serve as the Auditor. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for purposes of\n', b'determining the Gross-Up Payment in respect of any Payment, (i) any other\n', b'payments or benefits received or to be received by the Executive in connection\n', b"with a Change in Control or the Executive's termination of employment (whether\n", b'pursuant to the terms of this Agreement or any other plan, arrangement or\n', b'agreement with the Company, any person whose actions result in a Change in\n', b'Control or any person affiliated with the Company or such person) shall be\n', b'treated as "parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 280G(b)(2) of the\n', b'Code, and all "excess parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 280G of\n', b'the Code shall be treated as subject to the Excise Tax, unless in the opinion of\n', b'tax counsel selected by the Auditor, such other payments or benefits (in whole\n', b'or in part) do not constitute parachute payments, or are otherwise not subject\n', b'to the Excise Tax, and (ii) the Executive shall be deemed to pay federal income\n', b'tax at the highest marginal rate applicable in the calendar year in which the\n', b'Gross-Up Payment is made, and state and local income taxes at the highest\n', b"marginal rate of taxation in the state and locality of the Executive's residence\n", b'on the Date of Termination, net of the maximum reduction in federal income taxes\n', b'which could be obtained from deduction of such state and local taxes. In the\n', b'event the actual Excise Tax or such income tax is more or less than the amount\n', b'used to calculate the Gross-Up Payment, the Executive or the Company, as the\n', b'case may be, shall pay to the other an amount reflecting the actual Excise Tax\n', b'or such income tax, plus interest on the amount of such repayment at the rate\n', b'provided in Section 1274(b)(2)(B) of the Code.\n', b'\n', b'                                        12\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'13. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, REMOVAL OF DOCUMENTS, NON-COMPETITION.\n', b'\n', b'        (a) CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. The Executive shall hold in a fiduciary\n', b'capacity for the benefit of the Company and its subsidiaries (the "Sunbeam\n', b'Entities") all trade secrets, confidential information, and knowledge or data\n', b'relating to the Sunbeam Entities and the businesses and investments of the\n', b'Sunbeam Entities, which shall have been obtained by the Executive during the\n', b"Executive's employment by the Company, including such information with respect\n", b'to any products, improvements, formulas, designs or styles, processes, services,\n', b'customers, suppliers, marketing techniques, methods, future plans or operating\n', b'practices ("Confidential Information"); PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that Confidential\n', b'Information shall not include any information known generally to the public\n', b'(other than as a result of unauthorized disclosure by the Executive) or any\n', b'specific information or type of information generally not considered\n', b'confidential by persons engaged in the same business as the Company, or\n', b'information disclosed by the Company or any officer thereof to a third party\n', b'without restrictions on the disclosure of such information. Except as may be\n', b'required or appropriate in connection with his carrying out his duties under\n', b'this Agreement, the Executive shall not, without the prior written consent of\n', b'the Company or as may otherwise be required by law or legal process, communicate\n', b'or divulge any such Confidential Information to anyone other than the Company\n', b'and those designated by the Company.\n', b'\n', b'        (b) REMOVAL OF DOCUMENTS. All records, files, drawings, documents,\n', b'models, and the like relating to the business of the Sunbeam Entities, which the\n', b'Executive prepares, uses or comes into contact with and which contain\n', b'Confidential Information shall not be removed by the Executive from the premises\n', b'of any Sunbeam Entity (without the written consent of the Company) during or\n', b'after the Employment Period unless such removal shall be required or appropriate\n', b'in connection with his carrying out his duties under this Agreement, and, if so\n', b'removed by the Executive, shall be returned to such Sunbeam Entity immediately\n', b"upon termination of the Executive's employment hereunder.\n", b'\n', b"        (c) NON-COMPETITION. During (i) the Executive's employment with the\n", b"Company and (ii) the two (2) year period immediately following the Executive's\n", b'Date of Termination, the Executive (A) shall not engage, anywhere within the\n', b'geographical areas in which any Sunbeam Entity is then conducting its business\n', b'operations, directly or indirectly, alone, in association with or as a\n', b'shareholder, principal, agent, partner, officer, director, employee or\n', b'\n', b'                                       13\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'consultant of any other organization, in any business (a "Competitive Business")\n', b'which competes with any business then being conducted by such Sunbeam Entity;\n', b'(B) shall not solicit or encourage any officer, employee or consultant of any of\n', b'the Sunbeam Entities to leave the employ of any of the Sunbeam Entities for\n', b'employment by or with any Competitive Business; and (C) shall not solicit,\n', b'divert or take away, or attempt to divert or to take away, the business or\n', b'patronage of any of the customers or accounts, or prospective customers or\n', b'accounts, of any Sunbeam Entity, which were contacted, solicited or served by\n', b'the Executive while employed by the Company; provided, however, that nothing\n', b'herein shall prohibit the Executive from owning a maximum of two percent (2%) of\n', b'the outstanding stock of any publicly traded corporation. Following the Date of\n', b'Termination, ownership by the Executive of not more than five percent (5%) of\n', b'any publicly traded corporation shall not constitute a violation hereof. If, at\n', b'any time, the provisions of this Section 14(c) shall be determined to be invalid\n', b'or unenforceable, by reason of being vague or unreasonable as to area, duration\n', b'or scope of activity, this Section 14(c) shall be considered divisible and shall\n', b'become and be immediately amended to only such area, duration and scope of\n', b'activity as shall be determined to be reasonable and enforceable by the court or\n', b'other body having jurisdiction over the matter; and the Executive agrees that\n', b'this Section 14(c) as so amended shall be valid and binding as though any\n', b'invalid or unenforceable provision had not been included herein. For purposes of\n', b'this Section 14(c), the design, manufacture and marketing of outdoor barbecue\n', b'grills and small kitchen appliances shall be construed to be a Competitive\n', b'Business; provided, however, that the gross revenues derived from sales of such\n', b'products by such competitor are greater than the lesser of (i) 10% of its total\n', b'revenues and (ii) $500,000,000.\n', b'\n', b'        (d) REMEDIES. In the event of a breach or threatened breach of this\n', b'Section 14, the Executive agrees that the Company shall be entitled to apply for\n', b'injunctive relief in a court of appropriate jurisdiction to remedy any such\n', b'breach or threatened breach, the Executive acknowledging that damages would be\n', b'inadequate and insufficient.\n', b'\n', b"        (e) CONTINUING OPERATION.
