FANNIN (the "Executive") and SUNBEAM CORPORATION, a\n', b'Delaware corporation (the "Company").\n', b'\n', b'                                    RECITALS\n', b'\n', b'         WHEREAS, the Executive is a party to the Employment Agreement with the\n', b'Company dated as of July 29, 1996 (the "Prior Agreement");\n', b'\n', b'         WHEREAS, Company desires to continue to employ the Executive and the\n', b'Executive desires to continue to furnish services to the Company on the terms\n', b'and conditions hereinafter set forth;\n', b'\n', b'         WHEREAS, the parties desire to enter into this Agreement setting forth\n', b'the revised terms and conditions of the employment relationship of the Executive\n', b'with the Company; and\n', b'\n', b'         WHEREAS, the parties desire to provide for the termination of the Prior\n', b'Agreement, effective upon the Effective Date;\n', b'\n', b'         NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the mutual\n', b'agreements set forth below, the parties hereby agree as follows:\n', b'\n', b'                 1. EMPLOYMENT. The Company hereby agrees to employ the\n', b'Executive, and the Executive hereby accepts such employment, on the terms and\n', b'conditions hereinafter set forth.\n', b'\n', b'                 2. EMPLOYMENT PERIOD. The period of employment of the Executive\n', b'by the Company hereunder (the "Employment Period") shall commence as of the\n', b'Effective Date and shall end on January 31, 2001 (or the Date of Termination (as\n', b'defined in Section 10 below), if earlier). All options awards granted pursuant\n', b'to the Prior Agreement shall vest and become exercisable in full as of the\n', b'Execution Date. In addition, 40% of the restricted stock granted pursuant to the\n', b'Prior Agreement which is subject to restrictions immediately prior to the\n', b'Execution Date shall be forfeited as of the Execution Date, and the remaining\n', b'shares of such restricted stock shall become vested in full as of the Execution\n', b'Date and the\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'Company shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up basis for any federal\n', b'income tax assessed upon him upon the vesting of such restricted stock.\n', b'\n', b'                 3. POSITION AND DUTIES. The Executive shall serve as Executive\n', b'Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary, and shall have such\n', b'responsibilities, duties and authority as are consistent with such position and\n', b'such other duties as may from time to time be assigned to him by the Chief\n', b'Executive Officer. The Executive agrees to devote substantially all his working\n', b'time, attention and energies to the performance of his duties for the Company.\n', b'\n', b'                 4. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE. The principal place of employment of\n', b"the Executive shall be at the Company's principal executive offices in Broward\n", b'or Palm Beach County, Florida, or such other location as may be agreed to by the\n', b"Board. In the event that the Company's principal executive offices are moved\n", b'from Broward or Palm Beach County, Florida, the Company shall promptly pay, or\n', b'reimburse the Executive for, all reasonable expenses incurred by the Executive\n', b"relating to any change of the Executive's residence from Broward or Palm Beach\n", b'County, Florida, in connection with his employment hereunder, including, without\n', b'limitation, reasonable expenses for himself and his family of travel, moving,\n', b'storage and suitable lodging and maintenance, and the Company shall reimburse\n', b'the Executive on a grossed up basis in the event that any tax is assessed upon\n', b'him in relation to any such expenses. The Company shall pay or reimburse the\n', b'Executive for all reasonable costs and expenses of residential relocation\n', b'incurred by him in connection with each and every additional change, if any, in\n', b'the location of the principal executive offices of the Company, and the\n', b'Executive shall be reimbursed by the Company on a grossed up basis in the event\n', b'that any tax is assessed upon him in relation to any such costs or expenses.\n', b'\n', b'                 5. COMPENSATION AND RELATED MATTERS.\n', b'\n', b'                          (a) BASE SALARY. As compensation for the performance\n', b'by the Executive of his duties hereunder, during the Employment Period the\n', b'Company shall pay the Executive a base salary at an annual rate of $595,000,\n', b'which rate shall be retroactive to the Effective Date (the "Base Salary").\n', b'Except for the adjustment necessary to implement the retroactive increase in\n', b'Base Salary described in the immediately preceding sentence, the Base Salary\n', b'shall be payable in substantially equal semi-monthly installments. It is agreed\n', b'that there shall be no increase or decrease in the Base Salary during the\n', b'Employment Period. The parties agree that the Executive shall not be entitled to\n', b'participate in any other bonus or incentive compensation programs of the\n', b'Company.\n', b'\n', b'                          (b) EQUITY AND STOCK OPTION GRANTS.\n', b'\n', b'                                   (i) RESTRICTED SHARES. Effective as of the\n', b'         Effective Date, the Executive has been granted without cost to the\n', b'         Executive, 30,000 shares of Restricted Stock (as defined in the\n', b'         Company\'s Stock Option Plan) (herein referred to as the "Restricted\n', b'         Shares"). The Restricted Shares are granted upon the terms and\n', b'         conditions as set forth in the Option Plan, except that twenty-five\n', b'         percent of such Restricted\n', b'\n', b'                                        2\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'         Shares shall be vested and unrestricted as of the Execution Date, and\n', b'         an additional twenty-five percent of such Restricted Shares shall vest\n', b'         and cease to be restricted on each of the first, second and third\n', b'         anniversaries of the Effective Date (subject to earlier vesting\n', b'         provisions set forth in Section 11) provided that the Executive\n', b'         continues to be employed pursuant to this Agreement upon such\n', b'         anniversary dates and shall be subject to and modified by all other\n', b'         terms and provisions of this Agreement, as expressly set forth herein.\n', b'         All such Restricted Shares, once vested, shall be the sole property of\n', b'         the Executive, shall be unrestricted and shall be freely tradeable by\n', b'         the Executive, subject to applicable legal restrictions. The Company\n', b'         shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up basis with respect to any\n', b'         tax assessed upon him in connection with the vesting of any such\n', b'         Restricted Shares.\n', b'\n', b'                 (A) ISSUANCE OF CERTIFICATES. The Restricted Shares shall be\n', b"                 registered in the Executive's name, but the certificates\n", b'                 evidencing the Restricted Shares shall be retained by the\n', b'                 Company until such shares become vested and the restrictions\n', b'                 thereon lapse. The period prior to the time that any particular\n', b'                 Restricted Shares become vested and the restrictions thereon\n', b'                 lapse is hereinafter referred to as the "Restricted Period"\n', b'                 with respect to such shares. The Executive shall execute a\n', b'                 stock power, in blank, with respect to such Restricted Shares\n', b'                 and deliver the same to the Company.\n', b'\n', b'                 (B) RIGHTS AS A STOCKHOLDER. Except as provided herein, during\n', b'                 the Restricted Period, the Executive shall have all the rights\n', b'                 of a stockholder with respect to Restricted Shares, including\n', b'                 the right to receive dividends or other distributions and the\n', b'                 right to vote such shares; provided that, in the discretion of\n', b'                 the Company any such dividends or other distributions may be\n', b'                 retained by the Company unless and until the Restricted Shares\n', b'                 in respect of which such dividends or other distributions were\n', b'                 paid shall vest.\n', b'\n', b'                 (C) NON-TRANSFERABILITY. During the Restricted Period, the\n', b'                 Executive may not sell, transfer, pledge, or otherwise encumber\n', b'                 or dispose of the Restricted Shares, and any attempted sale,\n', b'                 transfer, pledge or other encumbrance or disposition (whether\n', b'                 voluntary or involuntary) in violation of this Section\n', b'                 5(b)(i)(C) shall be null and void.\n', b'\n', b'                 (D) DELIVERY OF SHARE CERTIFICATES. Upon the vesting of any\n', b'                 Restricted Shares, the certificates evidencing such Restricted\n', b'                 Shares, together with any dividends or other distributions\n', b'                 retained by the Company pursuant to Section 5(b)(i)(B), shall\n', b'                 be delivered promptly to the Executive. In the case of\n', b"                 Executive's death, such certificates, dividends and\n", b'                 distributions will be delivered to the beneficiary designated\n', b'                 in writing by the Executive pursuant to a form of designation\n', b"                 provided by the Company, to the Executive's legatee or\n", b'                 legatees, or to his personal representatives or distributees,\n', b'                 as the case may be.\n', b'\n', b'                                        3\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                                   (ii) STOCK OPTION. Effective as of the\n', b"         Effective Date, subject to shareholder approval by the Company's\n", b'         shareholders at the annual meeting to be held on May 12, 1998 (or on\n', b'         such other date on which such meeting will be held) (the "Annual\n', b'         Meeting"), the Executive has been granted a stock option (the "Option")\n', b'         to purchase 750,000 shares of Common Stock (the "Option Award"). The\n', b'         Option is subject to the following conditions: (i) the exercise price\n', b'         per share of Common Stock shall be $36.85, which is the average of the\n', b'         high and low selling price per share on the NYSE on January 30, 1998;\n', b'         (ii) the Option Award shall be vested and exercisable with respect to\n', b'         twenty-five percent of the shares subject thereto as of the Effective\n', b'         Date and shall become vested and exercisable with respect to an\n', b'         additional twenty-five percent of the shares subject thereto on each of\n', b'         the first, second and third anniversaries of the Effective Date; and\n', b'         (iii) the Option Award shall expire on the tenth anniversary of the\n', b'         Effective Date, subject to earlier termination as provided herein.\n', b'\n', b"                 In the event that Company's shareholders fail to approve the\n", b'         grant of the Option Award at the Annual Meeting, the Company and the\n', b'         Executive shall negotiate in good faith a mutually acceptable\n', b'         alternative compensation arrangement; provided, however, that the\n', b'         Executive, in his sole discretion, may elect to terminate this\n', b'         Agreement, in which event it shall be deemed to have been terminated\n', b'         pursuant to Section 10(d) hereof, and the Executive shall be entitled\n', b'         to receive the compensation, rights and benefits provided in Section\n', b'         11(e) hereof (other than in respect of the stock options).\n', b'\n', b'                                   (iii) REGISTRATION RIGHTS. Within six months\n', b'         after the Effective Date, the Company shall cause the Restricted Shares\n', b'         and all shares of stock subject to the Option Award to be registered or\n', b'         qualified for resale under the Securities Act of 1933 and applicable\n', b'         state laws. Unless and until registered under the Securities Act of\n', b'         1933, as amended, certificates evidencing the Restricted Shares and\n', b'         shares acquired pursuant to the exercise of the Option shall bear the\n', b'         following legend:\n', b'\n', b'                 THE SHARES EVIDENCED BY THIS CERTIFICATE MAY NOT BE SOLD,\n', b'                 TRANSFERRED, PLEDGED, HYPOTHECATED OR OTHERWISE DISPOSED OF\n', b'                 UNLESS REGISTERED UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS AMENDED,\n', b'                 OR UNLESS, IN THE OPINION OF COUNSEL FOR THE COMPANY, SUCH\n', b'                 REGISTRATION IS NOT REQUIRED.\n', b'\n', b'                 6. EXPENSES. During the Employment Period, the Company shall\n', b'reimburse the Executive for all reasonable business expenses in accordance with\n', b'applicable policies and procedures then in force.\n', b'\n', b'                 7. VACATION AND OTHER ABSENCES. The Executive shall be entitled\n', b'to paid vacation and other paid absences, whether for holidays, illness,\n', b'personal time or any similar purposes, during the Employment Period in\n', b'accordance with policies applicable generally to senior executives of the\n', b'Company; provided, however, that the Executive shall always be\n', b'\n', b'                                        4\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'entitled to at least six weeks of paid vacation in each calendar year and pro\n', b'rata for part of a year. Up to four weeks per year of unused vacation may be\n', b'maintained by the Executive on a cumulative basis and may be subsequently used\n', b'in any year or if not so used, the Executive shall be compensated for any unused\n', b'vacation days upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason.\n', b'\n', b'                 8. TAX PLANNING SERVICES. During the Employment Period, the\n', b'Company shall provide the Executive with tax-related advice and services without\n', b'cost or expense to him and shall reimburse the Executive on a grossed up basis\n', b'in the event that any tax is assessed upon him in relation to such services.\n', b'\n', b'                 9. OTHER BENEFITS. During the Employment Period, the Executive\n', b'shall be eligible to participate at no cost or expense to him in welfare plans\n', b'and programs (including any tax-deferred savings plan, group life insurance\n', b'plan, medical and dental insurance plan, and accident and disability insurance\n', b'plan) ("Benefit Plans") applicable generally to employees and/or senior\n', b'executives of the Company. The Company will waive, or obtain the waiver of, any\n', b'waiting periods for eligibility under the Benefit Plans or will provide\n', b'comparable benefits to the Executive without cost to him during the waiting\n', b'period.\n', b'\n', b"                 10. TERMINATION. The Executive's employment hereunder, as the\n", b'case may be, may be terminated as follows:\n', b'\n', b"                          (a) DEATH. The Executive's employment shall terminate\n", b'upon his death, and the date of his death shall be the Date of Termination.\n', b'\n', b"                          (b) DISABILITY. If, as a result of the Executive's\n", b'incapacity due to physical or mental illness, the Executive shall have been\n', b'absent from his duties hereunder on a full-time basis for one hundred and twenty\n', b'(120) consecutive days and, within thirty (30) days after written Notice of\n', b'Termination (as defined in Section 10(g) hereof), shall not have returned to the\n', b'performance of his duties hereunder on a full-time basis ("Disability"), the\n', b"Company may terminate the Executive's employment hereunder. In this event, the\n", b'Date of Termination shall be thirty (30) days after Notice of Termination is\n', b'given (provided that the Executive shall not have returned to the performance of\n', b'his duties on a full-time basis during such thirty (30) day period).\n', b'\n', b"                          (c) CAUSE. The Company may terminate the Executive's\n", b'employment hereunder for Cause. For purposes of this Agreement, the Company\n', b'shall have "Cause" to terminate the Executive\'s employment hereunder:\n', b'\n', b"                                   (i) upon the Executive's conviction for the\n", b'         commission of a felony (or a plea of nolo contendere thereto); or\n', b'\n', b'                                   (ii) willful failure by the Executive\n', b'         substantially to perform his duties hereunder (other than any such\n', b"         failure resulting from the Executive's incapacity due to Disability).\n", b'\n', b'                                        5\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                 For purposes hereof, no act or failure to act by the Executive\n', b'shall be considered "willful" unless done or omitted to be done by him not in\n', b'good faith or without reasonable belief that his action or omission was in the\n', b'best interests of the Company or contrary to written instructions of the Chief\n', b'Executive Officer or the Board of Directors. The Date of Termination shall be\n', b'the date specified in the Notice of Termination; provided, however, that, in the\n', b'case of a termination for Cause under clause (ii) above, the Date of Termination\n', b'shall not be earlier than 30 days after delivery of the Notice of Termination.\n', b'Anything herein to the contrary notwithstanding, if, following a termination of\n', b"the Executive's employment by the Company for Cause based upon the conviction of\n", b'the Executive for a felony, such conviction is overturned in a final\n', b'determination on appeal, the Executive shall be entitled to the payments and the\n', b'economic equivalent of the benefits the Executive would have received if his\n', b'employment had been terminated by the Company without Cause.\n', b'\n', b'                          (d) TERMINATION BY THE EXECUTIVE FOR GOOD REASON. The\n', b'Executive may terminate his employment hereunder for Good Reason, provided that\n', b'the Executive shall have delivered a Notice of Termination (as defined in\n', b'Section 10(g) hereof) within ninety (90) days after the occurrence of the event\n', b'of Good Reason giving rise to such termination. For purposes of this Agreement,\n', b'"Good Reason" shall mean the occurrence of one or more of the following\n', b"circumstances, without the Executive's express written consent, which are not\n", b"remedied by the Company within thirty (30) days of receipt of the Executive's\n", b'Notice of Termination:\n', b'\n', b'                                   (i) an assignment to the Executive of any\n', b'         duties materially inconsistent with his positions, duties,\n', b'         responsibilities and status with the Company or any material limitation\n', b'         of the powers of the Executive not consistent with the powers of the\n', b'         Executive contemplated by Section 3 hereof; or\n', b'\n', b'                                   (ii) any removal of the Executive from, or\n', b'         any failure to re-elect the Executive to, the executive officer\n', b'         position specified in Section 3 of this Agreement; or\n', b'\n', b'                                   (iii) any other material breach by the\n', b'         Company of this Agreement.\n', b'\n', b'                 In the event of a termination for Good Reason, the Date of\n', b'Termination shall be the date specified in the Notice of Termination, which\n', b'shall be no more than thirty (30) days after the Notice of Termination.\n', b'\n', b'                          (e) OTHER TERMINATIONS. The Company may terminate the\n', b"Executive's employment hereunder at any time, subject to the provisions of\n", b'Section 11(e) hereof. The Executive may terminate his employment at any time\n', b"subject to the provisions of Section 11(d) hereof. If the Executive's employment\n", b'is terminated hereunder for any reason other than as set forth in Sections 10(a)\n', b'through 10(d) hereof, the date on which a\n', b'\n', b'                                        6\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'Notice of Termination is given or any later date (within 30 days) set forth in\n', b'such Notice of Termination shall be the Date of Termination.\n', b'\n', b'                          (f) TERMINATION BY THE EXECUTIVE UPON CHANGE IN\n', b'CONTROL. Upon a Change in Control (as defined below), the Executive shall have\n', b'the right, upon delivery to the Company of a Notice of Termination (which shall\n', b'specify a Date of Termination not less than 30 days after such Notice of\n', b'Termination), to terminate his employment under this Agreement and to receive\n', b'the payments provided pursuant to Section 11(f) below. If the Executive shall\n', b'elect to terminate his employment with the Company other than upon a Change in\n', b'Control, he shall receive only the compensation referred to in Section 11(d)\n', b'below. For purposes of this Agreement, a Change in Control shall mean the\n', b'occurrence of any one of the following events:\n', b'\n', b'                                   (i) any "person" as such term is used in\n', b'         Sections 3(a)(9) and 13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as\n', b'         amended, becomes a "beneficial owner," as such term is used in Rule\n', b'         3d-3 promulgated under that Act, of 25% or more of the voting stock of\n', b'         the Company (other than a person that is currently the beneficial owner\n', b"         of such percentage of the Company's voting stock),\n", b'\n', b'                                   (ii) the majority of the Board consists of\n', b'         individuals other than Incumbent Directors, which term means the\n', b'         members of the Board on the date of this Agreement and the individuals\n', b'         designated as directors by the Chief Executive Officer of the Company;\n', b'         provided that any person becoming a director subsequent to such date\n', b'         whose election or nomination for election was supported by two-thirds\n', b'         of the directors who then comprised the Incumbent Directors shall be\n', b'         considered to be an Incumbent Director;\n', b'\n', b"                                   (iii) the Company, without the Executive's\n", b'         consent, adopts any plan of liquidation providing for the distribution\n', b'         of all or substantially all of its assets; or\n', b'\n', b'                                   (iv) all or substantially all of the assets\n', b'         or business of the Company are disposed of pursuant to a merger,\n', b'         consolidation or other transaction (unless the shareholders of the\n', b'         Company immediately prior to such merger, consolidation or other\n', b'         transaction beneficially own, directly or indirectly, in substantially\n', b'         the same proportion as they owned the voting stock of the Company, all\n', b'         of the voting stock or other ownership interests of the entity or\n', b'         entities, if any, that succeed to the business of the Company).\n', b'\n', b'                          (g) NOTICE OF TERMINATION. Any termination of the\n', b"Executive's employment hereunder by the Company or by the Executive (other than\n", b'termination pursuant to Section 10(a) hereof) shall be communicated by written\n', b'Notice of Termination to the other party hereto in accordance with Section 17\n', b'hereof. For purposes of this Agreement, a "Notice of Termination" shall mean a\n', b'notice which shall indicate the specific termination provision in this Agreement\n', b'relied upon and shall set forth in reasonable detail the facts and\n', b'\n', b'                                        7\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b"circumstances claimed to provide a basis for termination of the Executive's\n", b'employment under the provision so indicated. If any dispute concerning a Notice\n', b"of Termination of the Executive's employment under Section 10(b), 10(c) or 10(d)\n", b'hereof results in a determination that a proper basis for such termination did\n', b"not exist under such section, the Executive's employment under this Agreement\n", b'shall be treated, with respect to a Notice of Termination pursuant to Section\n', b'10(b) or 10(c) hereof, as having been terminated pursuant to Section 10(e)\n', b'hereof or, with respect to a Notice of Termination pursuant to Section 10(d)\n', b'hereof, as having not been terminated.\n', b'\n', b'                 11. COMPENSATION UPON TERMINATION OR DURING DISABILITY.\n', b'\n', b'                          (a) DISABILITY PERIOD. During any period during the\n', b'Employment Period that the Executive fails to perform his duties hereunder as a\n', b'result of incapacity due to physical or mental illness ("Disability Period"),\n', b'the Executive shall continue to (i) receive his full Base Salary and (ii)\n', b'participate in the Benefit Plans. Such payments made to the Executive during the\n', b'Disability Period shall be reduced by the sum of the amounts, if any, payable to\n', b'the Executive at or prior to the time of any such payment under disability\n', b'benefit plans of the Company or under the Social Security disability insurance\n', b'program, and which amounts were not previously applied to reduce any such\n', b'payment.\n', b'\n', b"                          (b) DEATH. If the Executive's employment hereunder is\n", b'terminated as a result of death, then:\n', b'\n', b"                                   (i) the Company shall pay the Executive's\n", b'         estate or designated beneficiary, as soon as practicable after the Date\n', b'         of Termination, any Base Salary installments due in the month of death\n', b'         and any reimbursable expenses, accrued or owing the Executive hereunder\n', b'         as of the Date of Termination;\n', b'\n', b'                                   (ii) the Options granted to the Executive\n', b'         pursuant to the Option Award (if such Option Award has been approved by\n', b'         the shareholders as provided in Section 5(b)(ii)) shall become vested\n', b'         and exercisable, as of the Date of Termination, to the extent such\n', b'         Option Award would have otherwise become vested on or before the first\n', b'         anniversary of the Date of Termination, and all vested Options, as well\n', b'         as all stock options granted pursuant to the Prior Agreement ("Prior\n', b'         Agreement Options") shall remain exercisable for a period of one year\n', b'         following such Date of Termination and shall thereafter be completely\n', b'         forfeited and cancelled; any Options that would not have become vested\n', b'         and exercisable on or before the first anniversary of the Date of\n', b'         Termination shall terminate and be forfeited as of the Date of\n', b'         Termination; and\n', b'\n', b'                                   (iii) the portion of the Restricted Shares\n', b'         that have not vested as of the Date of Termination equal to the number\n', b'         of such unvested Restricted Shares multiplied by a fraction, the\n', b'         numerator of which is 36 minus the number of full months remaining in\n', b'         the Employment Period (disregarding the earlier termination thereof)\n', b'         after the Date of Termination and denominator of which is 36, shall\n', b'         become\n', b'\n', b'                                        8\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'         vested as of the Date of Termination and the restrictions imposed\n', b'         thereon shall lapse. The balance of such unvested Restricted Shares\n', b'         shall be forfeited to the Company (without further action on the part\n', b'         of the Company or the Executive) as of the Date of Termination, and the\n', b'         Executive shall have no further rights with respect to such balance.\n', b'\n', b"                          (c) DISABILITY. The\n', b'         balance of such unvested Restricted Shares shall be forfeited to the\n', b'         Company (without further action on the part of the Company or the\n', b'         Executive) as of the Date of Termination, and the Executive shall have\n', b'         no further rights with respect to such balance.\n', b'\n', b'                          (d) CAUSE OR BY EXECUTIVE OTHER THAN FOR GOOD REASON.\n', b"If the Executive's employment hereunder is terminated by the Company for Cause\n", b'or by the Executive other than for Good Reason, then:\n', b'\n', b'                                   (i) the Company shall pay the Executive, as\n', b'         soon as practicable after the Date of Termination, any Base Salary and\n', b'         any reimbursable expenses accrued or owing the Executive hereunder for\n', b'         services as of the Date of Termination; and\n', b'\n', b'                                   (ii) the Executive shall immediately forfeit\n', b'         any unvested Restricted Shares and any unvested portion of the Option\n', b'         Award. GROSS-UP FOR EXCISE TAX. In the event that the Executive\n', b'receives any payment or benefit (including but not limited to the payments or\n', b'benefits pursuant to Section 11 of this Agreement) (a "Payment") that is subject\n', b'to the excise tax (the "Excise Tax") under Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue\n', b'Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code"), the Company shall pay to the Executive,\n', b'as soon thereafter as practicable, an additional amount (a "Gross-Up Payment")\n', b'such that the net amount retained by the Executive, after deduction of any\n', b'Excise Tax imposed upon the Payment and any federal, state and local income tax\n', b'and Excise Tax imposed upon the Gross-Up Payment shall be equal to the Payment.\n', b'The determination of whether an Excise Tax is due in respect of any payment or\n', b'benefit, the amount of the Excise Tax and the amount of the Gross-Up Payment\n', b'shall be made by an independent auditor (the "Auditor") jointly selected by the\n', b'Company and the Executive and paid by the Company. If the Executive and the\n', b'Company cannot agree on the firm to serve as the Auditor, then the Executive and\n', b'the Company shall each select one nationally recognized accounting firm and\n', b'those two firms shall jointly select the nationally recognized accounting firm\n', b'to serve as the Auditor. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for purposes of\n', b'determining the Gross-Up Payment in respect of any Payment, (i) any other\n', b'payments or benefits received or to be received by the Executive in connection\n', b"with a Change in Control or the Executive's termination of employment (whether\n", b'pursuant to the terms of this Agreement or any other plan, arrangement or\n', b'agreement with the Company, any person whose actions result in a Change in\n', b'Control or any person affiliated with the Company or such person) shall be\n', b'treated as "parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 28OG(b)(2) of the\n', b'Code, and all "excess parachute payments" within the meaning of Section 28OG of\n', b'the Code shall be treated as subject to the Excise Tax, unless in the opinion of\n', b'tax counsel selected by the Auditor, such other payments or benefits (in whole\n', b'or in part) do not constitute parachute payments, or are otherwise not subject\n', b'to the Excise Tax, and (ii) the Executive shall be deemed to pay federal income\n', b'tax at the highest marginal rate applicable in the calendar year in which the\n', b'Gross-Up Payment is made, and state and local income taxes at the highest\n', b"marginal rate of taxation in the state and locality of the Executive's residence\n", b'on the Date of Termination, net of the maximum reduction in federal income taxes\n', b'which could be obtained from deduction of such state and local taxes. In the\n', b'event the actual Excise Tax or such income tax is more or less than the amount\n', b'used to calculate the Gross-Up Payment, the Executive or the Company, as the\n', b'case may be, shall pay to the other an amount reflecting the actual Excise Tax\n', b'or such income tax, plus interest on the amount of such repayment at the rate\n', b'provided in Section 1274(b)(2)(B) of the Code.\n', b'\n', b'                 13. THE PLAN, THE COMPANY. SUNBEAM CORPORATION (formerly known as Sunbeam-Oster\n', b'Company, Inc.) (the "Company") established the Sunbeam-Oster Company, Inc. Execu\n', b'tive Benefit Retirement Plan effective as of December 15, 1994, and hereby\n', b'adopts the amendment and restatement of the plan, now known as SUNBEAM\n', b'CORPORATION EXEC UTIVE BENEFIT REPLACEMENT PLAN (the "Plan"). The Plan as set\n', b'forth herein is effec tive December 15, 1994 (the "Effective Date"), except as\n', b'otherwise specifically provided.\n', b'\n', b'1.2. EMPLOYERS. The Company and each other organization that is an employer\n', b'under SUN BEAM CORPORATION 401(k) SAVINGS AND PROFIT SHARING PLAN (the "401(k)\n', b'Plan") shall be an "Employer" under this Plan unless specified to the contrary\n', b'by the Company by writing filed with the Committee described in subsection 1.4.\n', b'\n', b'1.3. PURPOSE. The Company and certain related businesses maintain and are\n', b'employers under the 401(k) Plan, which is intended to meet the requirements of a\n', b'"qualified plan" under Sec tion 401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code. The purpose\n', b'of this Plan, a nonqualified plan, is generally to provide for eligible\n', b'employees benefits that such employees do not earn under the 401(k) Plan because\n', b'such employees do not participate in the 401(k) Plan.\n', b'\n', b'The Plan generally will allow Participants to elect to "make" before-tax\n', b'contributions to the Plan in the same amount and same manner as under the terms\n', b'of the 401(k) Plan; the Employ ers will provide "matching contributions" based\n', b"on a Participant's before-tax contributions; lastly, the Employers will\n", b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'provide "profit sharing contributions" allocated based on each Participant\'s\n', b'Compensation for a year. This Plan is an unfunded plan maintained primarily for\n', b'the purpose of providing deferred compensation for a select group of management\n', b'or highly-compensated employees, as such plans are described in Sections 201(2),\n', b'301(a)(3), and 401(a)(1) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.\n', b'"Contributions" to the Plan are reflected through credits to bookkeeping\n', b'accounts that are adjusted periodically to reflect hypothetical investment\n', b'earnings. Participants are entitled to receive from the general assets of the\n', b'Employers cash payments equal to the vested portion of their account balances,\n', b'as set forth in the Plan.\n', b'\n', b'1.4. PLAN ADMINISTRATION. The Plan is administered by the administrative\n', b'committee (the "Committee") that is responsible for administration of the 401(k)\n', b'Plan. To the extent appropriate, the Committee has the same powers, rights,\n', b'duties and obligations as are vested in the committee responsible for\n', b'administration of the 401(k) Plan.\n', b'\n', b'1.5. COMPENSATION. For purposes of computing contributions and benefits under\n', b'the Plan, an employee\'s "Compensation" shall mean his compensation as defined\n', b'from time to time in Section 1.14 of the 401(k) Plan, determined, however,\n', b'without regard to any limits under Section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue\n', b'Code.\n', b'\n', b'                                    SECTION 2\n', b'\n', b'                          ELIGIBILITY FOR PARTICIPATION\n', b'\n', b'2.1. COVERED EMPLOYEE. A "Covered Employee" means an employee of an Employer\n', b"under the Plan who is selected by the Company's board of directors or by a\n", b'person or committee authorized to act on behalf of the board of directors. An\n', b'employee who is selected shall con tinue as a Covered Employee until he\n', b'terminates employment with all Employers or until he is removed as a Covered\n', b"Employee by the Company's board of directors or by the\n", b'\n', b'                                      -2-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'person or committee authorized to act on its behalf effective as of the end of a\n', b'calendar year, whichever occurs first.\n', b'\n', b'2.2. ELIGIBILITY. Subject to the conditions and limitations of the Plan, an\n', b'employee of an Em ployer shall become eligible to enroll in this Plan and shall\n', b'become a "Participant" on the first date occurring on or after the Effective\n', b'Date on which he is a Covered Employee.\n', b'\n', b'2.3. PERIOD OF PARTICIPATION. An employee of an Employer who becomes a\n', b'Participant in this Plan will continue as a Participant in the Plan in\n', b'accordance with its provisions until all bene fits to which he is entitled under\n', b'the Plan have been distributed to him.\n', b'\n', b'                                    SECTION 3\n', b'\n', b'                                    BENEFITS\n', b'\n', b'3.1. INTENT. Commencing on the Effective Date, the provisions of this Section 3\n', b'are intended to allow a Participant to elect to make before-tax contributions,\n', b'to earn "matching contribu tions" that are at the same rate as those made by his\n', b'Employer on behalf of 401(k) Plan Partic ipants, and to earn "profit sharing\n', b'contributions" at the same rate as those made on behalf of participants under\n', b'the 401(k) Plan.\n', b'\n', b'3.2. BEFORE-TAX CONTRIBUTIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      For 1994, a Participant may elect to make Before-Tax\n', b'                  Contributions of any or all of his Compensation attributable\n', b'                  to services performed after the Effective Date (but not more\n', b'                  than $9,240). Beginning January 1, 1995, a Participant may\n', b'                  elect to make Before-Tax Contributions in whole multiples of\n', b'                  his Compensation from 1% to 10%, but not in excess of the\n', b'                  amount by which Before-Tax Contributions are limited in the\n', b'\n', b'                                      -3-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  401(k) Plan because of Section 402(g) of the Internal Revenue\n', b"                  Code. A Participant's Before-Tax Contributions under this\n", b'                  subsection 3.2 shall be made pursuant to a compensation\n', b'                  deferral election by which the Participant elects to have his\n', b'                  Compensation reduced by the amount provided in the election,\n', b"                  and the Employer shall credit such amount to the Participant's\n", b'                  account as provided in subsection 3.6.\n', b'\n', b"         (b)      An election shall be filed with the Participant's Employer\n", b'                  prior to the calendar year such contributions are to begin,\n', b'                  or, for contributions to be made in 1994, within ten days of\n', b'                  the Effective Date. If a Participant first becomes eligible to\n', b'                  make such contributions after the Effective Date and during,\n', b'                  but after the beginning of, any subsequent calendar year, such\n', b"                  Participant's deferral election must be filed with his Em\n", b'                  ployer not more than 30 days after so becoming eligible.\n', b'\n', b"         (c)      A Participant's compensation deferral election under this\n", b'                  subsection 3.2 shall apply to Compensation otherwise payable\n', b'                  after the later to occur of the date the Participant becomes\n', b'                  eligible to make Before-Tax Contri butions and the date the\n', b"                  election is filed with his Employer. A Partici pant's\n", b'                  compensation deferral election, however, may be revoked by the\n', b'                  Participant before the beginning of any subsequent calendar\n', b'                  year. The revocation shall be effective as to Compensation the\n', b'                  Participant is enti tled to receive during that and subsequent\n', b'                  calendar years unless prior to the commencement of any\n', b'                  subsequent calendar year the Participant makes another\n', b'                  compensation deferral election. Such later election shall\n', b'                  apply as to Compensation otherwise payable during calendar\n', b'                  years beginning after such later election is made.\n', b'\n', b"         (d)      Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Participant's compensation\n", b'                  deferral election automatically\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                      -4-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  shall be revoked for any period he ceases, in the sole opinion\n', b'                  of the Committee, to be a member of a select group of\n', b'                  management or a highly-compensated employee.\n', b'\n', b'3.3.  EMPLOYER MATCHING CONTRIBUTIONS.\n', b'\n', b"         (a)      For 1994, a Participant's Employer shall make a matching\n", b"                  contribution equal to 50% of the Participant's Before-Tax\n", b"                  Contributions for 1994; in addition the Participant's Employer\n", b'                  shall make a matching contribution equal to the matching\n', b'                  contribution the Participant is precluded from receiving under\n', b'                  the 401(k) Plan because of the limits of Internal Reve nue\n', b'                  Code Section 401(m). In no event will the matching\n', b'                  contribution for 1994 exceed $4,620.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      Beginning January 1, 1995, each calendar quarter a\n', b"                  Participant's Em ployer shall make a matching contribution on\n", b"                  behalf of the Participant equal to 100% of the Participant's\n", b'                  Before-Tax Contributions (disregard ing Before-Tax\n', b"                  Contributions in excess of 2% of a Participant's Compensation)\n", b'                  and 50% of the additional Before-Tax Contributions\n', b'                  (disregarding such contributions in excess of 4% of\n', b'                  Compensation) during the quarter, provided the Participant is\n', b'                  employed by an Em ployer on the last day of the quarter.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      In addition, beginning with the 1995 calendar year, a\n', b"                  Participant's Em ployer shall make an additional matching\n", b'                  contribution on behalf of the Participant as of the last day\n', b'                  of each calendar quarter so that the match ing contributions\n', b"                  for the Participant are equal to 100% of the Participant's\n", b'                  Before-Tax Contributions (disregarding Before-Tax Con\n', b"                  tributions in excess of 2% of the Participant's Compensation)\n", b'                  and 50% of the additional Before-Tax Contributions\n', b'                  (disregarding such contribu tions in excess of 4% of\n', b'                  Compensation) during the year, provided the\n', b'\n', b'                                      -5-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  Participant is employed by an Employer on the last day of the\n', b'                  quarter.\n', b'\n', b'         (d)      Such Employer contributions shall be called "Employer Matching\n', b'                  Con tributions." The Employers shall make such contributions\n', b"                  by crediting Participants' accounts as provided in subsection\n", b'                  3.6. Beginning with the 1995 calendar year, the Employer\n', b'                  Matching Contribution for a Par ticipant for any year shall\n', b'                  not exceed 50% of the then current limit un der Section 402(g)\n', b'                  of the Internal Revenue Code.\n', b'\n', b"3.4. EMPLOYER PROFIT SHARING CONTRIBUTIONS. Each calendar year, a Participant's\n", b'Employer shall make on behalf of the Participant an "Employer Profit Sharing\n', b'Contribution" in an amount equal to a percentage of the Participant\'s\n', b'Compensation for the year, such percentage to be the percentage of compensation\n', b'received as a profit sharing contribution for such year by eligible participants\n', b'in the 401(k) Plan; provided a Participant shall not receive a Profit Shar ing\n', b'Contribution for a year unless he is employed by an Employer on the last day of\n', b'the year or terminated employment with all Employers during the year because of\n', b'death, Disability or Retirement (as such terms are defined in the 401(k) Plan).\n', b"The Employer shall make the contributions by crediting the Participants'\n", b'accounts as provided in subsection 3.6.\n', b'\n', b'3.5. LIMITATION ON CONTRIBUTIONS. Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection\n', b'3.2, 3.3 and 3.4, in no event shall the contributions to the Plan made by or on\n', b'on behalf of a Participant ex ceed for any year the lesser of (a) $30,000 (or\n', b'such greater amount as may be provided under Section 415(c)(1)(A) of the\n', b'Internal Revenue Code); or (b) 25% of taxable earnings from the Employers as\n', b'reflected on Form W-2 (which earnings shall be adjusted by addition of any\n', b'compensation deferral contributions under this Plan and any deferrals or\n', b'reductions under Sections 401(k) and 125 of the Internal Revenue Code). The\n', b'limitation of this subsection shall be applied to reduce (i) first, Employer\n', b'Profit Sharing Contributions otherwise made on behalf of the Participant, and\n', b'(ii) then, Participant Before-Tax Contri-\n', b'\n', b'                                      -6-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'butions and any corre sponding Employer Matching Contributions made on behalf of\n', b'the Participant. The Employ ers shall compensate the Participant for any\n', b'Before-Tax Contributions that the Participant elected to make to the Plan but\n', b'that cannot be made because of such limitations.\n', b'\n', b'3.6. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS. The Committee shall maintain separate bookkeeping\n', b"accounts in the name of each Participant to reflect the Participant's Before-Tax\n", b'Contributions, and the Em ployer Matching and Profit Sharing Contributions made\n', b'on his behalf. Contributions shall be credited (and payments shall be debited)\n', b'to accounts in such manner and at such time as the Committee shall determine on\n', b"a uniform basis. A Participant's accounts shall be deemed invested in\n", b'hypothetical investment funds ("Funds") in such proportions as the Participant\n', b'may elect. The Funds shall be those in which 401(k) Plan participants may direct\n', b'the invest ment of their accounts, unless the Committee shall determine\n', b'otherwise. Each Participant shall elect the Funds in which his accounts are\n', b'deemed to be invested pursuant to rules adopt ed by the Committee. If the\n', b'Participant fails to select such Funds, the Participant shall be deemed to have\n', b"elected such Fund as the Committee shall determine. Each Participant's ac counts\n", b'shall be adjusted as of such dates specified by the Committee to reflect\n', b'contributions, payments and the investment gains and losses of the Funds. One of\n', b'the Funds shall reflect investment in common stock of the Company ("Company\n', b'Stock") subject to the following rules:\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      Employer Matching and Profit Sharing Contributions that are\n', b'                  credited to accounts on or after September 30, 1997 shall be\n', b'                  deemed invested in Company Stock, and Participants may not\n', b'                  elect otherwise.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      A Participant may elect that any percentage (up to 100%) of\n', b'                  the other portion of his existing accounts be deemed invested\n', b'                  in Company Stock, and any such election may not be reversed. A\n', b'                  Participant may elect that all or any percentage of his future\n', b'                  compensation deferrals be deemed invested in Company Stock,\n', b'                  and any such percentage may not be reduced.\n', b'\n', b'                                      -7-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      Any election to have any portion of his accounts deemed\n', b'                  invested in Company Stock shall be subject to such rules as\n', b'                  the Committee may determine for any reason, including\n', b'                  compliance with federal or state securities laws.\n', b'\n', b"3.7. TIME OF DISTRIBUTION; VESTING OF ACCOUNTS. DISTRIBUTION OF ACCOUNTS. Unless the Participant elects installment\n', b'distributions as pro vided below, benefits that become payable under this Plan\n', b'shall be paid in a lump sum as soon as practicable after the Participant has\n', b'terminated employment with all Employers. CLAIMS PROCEDURE. If a claim for benefits under the Plan is denied in whole\n', b'or in part, the employee will receive written notification. The notification\n', b'will include specific reasons for the denial, specific reference to pertinent\n', b'Plan provisions, a description of any additional material or information\n', b'necessary to process the claim and why such material or information is\n', b'necessary, and an explanation of the claims review procedure. If the Committee\n', b'fails to respond within 90 days, the claim is treated as denied.\n', b'\n', b'7.2. REVIEW PROCEDURE. Within 60 days after the claim is denied or, if the claim\n', b'is deemed denied, within 150 days after the claim is filed, an employee (or his\n', b'duly authorized repre sentative) may file a written request with the Committee\n', b'for a review of his denied claim. The employee may review pertinent documents\n', b'that were used in processing his claim, submit pertinent documents, and address\n', b'issues and comments in writing to the Committee. The Committee will notify the\n', b'employee of its final decision in writing. In its response, the Committee will\n', b'explain the reason for the decision, with specific references to pertinent Plan\n', b'provisions on which the decision was based.
