PURPOSE.\n', b'\n', b'         The purpose of the Sunbeam Corporation Stock Option Plan is to provide\n', b'         incentives for selected executives, key employees, Outside Directors\n', b'         and Designated Others to promote the financial success and progress of\n', b'         Sunbeam Corporation. Capitalized terms used throughout this Plan shall\n', b'         have the meanings ascribed to them in Section 16 hereof.\n', b'\n', b'2.       STOCK SUBJECT TO THE PLAN.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      Subject to the provisions of this Section and Section 9, the\n', b'                  maximum number of shares of Stock that may be issued under the\n', b'                  Plan is 11,500,000 shares, to be allocated as follows:\n', b'\n', b'                  (i)      11,300,000 shares may be issued in connection with\n', b'                           the grant of Options pursuant to Section 3; and\n', b'\n', b'                  (ii)     200,000 shares may be issued in connection with the\n', b'                           grant of Restricted Stock Awards pursuant to Section\n', b'                           3.\n', b'\n', b'                  Such shares may be either authorized but unissued shares or\n', b'                  treasury shares.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      The number of shares subject to an Option or a Restricted\n', b'                  Stock Award that has been granted under the Plan shall no\n', b'                  longer be charged against the limitation provided in Section\n', b'                  2(a), and may again be made subject to Options or Restricted\n', b'                  Stock Awards, as the case may be, to the extent that Options\n', b'                  expire unexercised or are terminated, surrendered or canceled\n', b'                  before exercise or Restricted Stock Awards are forfeited,\n', b"                  terminated, surrendered or canceled due to a Participant's\n", b'                  termination of employment or service as an Outside Director or\n', b'                  for any other reason.\n', b'\n', b'3.       GRANTS OF OPTIONS AND RESTRICTED STOCK AWARDS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      Subject to the provisions of the Plan, the Committee may at\n', b'                  any time, or from time to time, grant Options to officers, key\n', b'                  employees, Outside Directors of the Company (or its\n', b'                  subsidiaries) and Designated Others.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      Subject to the provisions of the Plan, the Committee may at\n', b'                  any time, or from time to time, grant shares of Stock which\n', b'                  are subject to the Restrictions set forth in Section 4(b)\n', b'                  ("Restricted Stock") to officers, key employees and Outside\n', b'                  Directors of the Company (or its subsidiaries) and Designated\n', b'                  Others.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      The Committee shall cause shares of Restricted Stock to be\n', b'                  issued to each Outside Director immediately and automatically\n', b'                  upon his or her election, re-election or appointment as a\n', b'                  Director of the Company. If such Outside Director is elected\n', b'                  at an Annual Meeting of the Shareholders of the Company (the\n', b'                  "Annual Meeting"), the number of shares of Restricted Stock to\n', b'                  be issued shall be 1,500. The number of shares of Restricted\n', b'                  Stock to be issued to an Outside Director who is \n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  elected or appointed at any time other than at an Annual\n', b'                  Meeting shall be 1,500 multiplied by a fraction, the numerator\n', b'                  of which shall be the number of days after the date of such\n', b'                  election to and including the date of the next Annual Meeting\n', b'                  (which for such purpose shall be assumed to be the next May\n', b'                  15) and the denominator of which shall be 365; provided,\n', b'                  however, (i) that in the case of an Outside Director elected\n', b'                  to the Board for the first time during the period beginning\n', b'                  August 1, 1996 and ending December 31, 1996, the number of\n', b'                  such shares shall not be prorated, and each such Outside\n', b'                  Director shall receive 1,500 shares for the period of his\n', b'                  service between the date of his election and the date of the\n', b'                  next Annual Meeting (assumed to be May 15, 1997); and (ii)\n', b'                  that each incumbent Outside Director, elected prior to August\n', b'                  1, 1996, shall receive that number of shares of Restricted\n', b'                  Stock which results from applying to 1,500 such shares the\n', b'                  proration formula provided above, using for such calculation\n', b'                  the period from August 6, 1996 until and including the date of\n', b'                  the next Annual Meeting (assumed to be May 15, 1997).\n', b'\n', b'         (d)      Deleted.\n', b'\n', b'         (e)      Each Option shall be evidenced by a Stock Option Agreement,\n', b'                  and each Restricted Stock Award shall be evidenced by a\n', b'                  Restricted Stock Award Agreement, each in a form approved by\n', b'                  the Committee or by a Company officer designated by the\n', b'                  Committee.\n', b'\n', b'         (f)      Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan, no person\n', b'                  shall be granted Options for more than 250,000 shares of Stock\n', b'                  or Restricted Stock Awards for more than 25,000 shares of\n', b'                  Stock in any single fiscal year of the Company.\n', b'\n', b'4.       TERMS AND CONDITIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      OPTIONS.\n', b'\n', b'                  (i)      An Option shall entitle the Participant who holds it\n', b'                           to exercise the Option on and subject to the terms,\n', b'                           conditions and restrictions of the Plan (as the Plan\n', b'                           may be amended from time to time) and such additional\n', b'                           terms, conditions and restrictions as may be imposed\n', b'                           by the Committee at the time of grant.\n', b'\n', b'                  (ii)     Unless otherwise specified by the Committee, the term\n', b'                           of each Option granted prior to May 15, 1996 (herein\n', b'                           the "1996 Amendment Date") and which is In-the-Money\n', b'                           as of the 1996 Amendment Date shall commence on the\n', b'                           date of grant of the Option and shall expire at the\n', b'                           close of business on the earlier of (A) the tenth\n', b'                           anniversary of the date of grant or (B) the 45th day\n', b"                           following the termination of the Participant's\n", b'                           employment with, or service as director of, the\n', b'                           Company (or a subsidiary). Unless otherwise specified\n', b'                           by the Committee, the term of each Option granted on\n', b'                           or after the 1996 Amendment Date and the term of each\n', b'                           Option granted prior to the 1996 Amendment Date which\n', b'                           is Out- of-the-Money as of the 1996 Amendment Date,\n', b'                           shall commence on the Grant Date of the Option and\n', b'                           shall expire at the close of business on the earliest\n', b'                           of (A) the tenth anniversary of the Grant Date; or\n', b'                           (B) the third anniversary of the date of termination\n', b"                           of the Participant's employment with, or service as a\n", b'                           director of, the Company (or a subsidiary), in the\n', b'                           case of retirement or termination by the Company\n', b'                           without Cause; or (C) 90 days after the date of\n', b'                           termination of employment in the case of resignation,\n', b'                           voluntary departure or termination by the Company\n', b'                           with Cause; or (D) in the case of a Designated Other,\n', b'                           the \n', b'\n', b'                                       2\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                           date specified in the Stock Option Agreement.\n', b'                           Notwithstanding the foregoing sentence, Participants\n', b'                           who are subject to Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act\n', b'                           shall have until the earlier of (A) the tenth\n', b'                           anniversary of the Grant Date; or (B) the third\n', b'                           anniversary of the date of termination of their\n', b'                           employment with, or service as a director of the\n', b'                           Company, regardless of the cause, within which to\n', b'                           exercise Options which are granted on or after the\n', b'                           1996 Amendment Date and Options which are\n', b'                           Out-of-the-Money as of the 1996 Amendment Date;\n', b'                           provided, however, that no such Option may be\n', b'                           exercised by any such person during the period\n', b'                           beginning on the date of termination and ending on\n', b'                           the six month anniversary of the date of termination.\n', b'\n', b'                  (iii)    All Restrictions shall lapse with respect to the\n', b'                           Restricted Stock subject to a Restricted Stock Award\n', b'                           made to an Outside Director pursuant to Section 3(c)\n', b'                           hereof immediately and automatically upon the\n', b"                           Director's acceptance of election or appointment as a\n", b'                           Director of the Company, as evidenced in such manner\n', b'                           as may be established by the Committee. Unless\n', b'                           otherwise specified by the Committee (which is\n', b'                           empowered to provide different vesting schedules with\n', b'                           respect to any grant of Options or Restricted Stock),\n', b'                           all other Options granted under the Plan (from and\n', b'                           after July 18, 1996) shall become exercisable with\n', b'                           respect to one-third of the shares subject to the\n', b'                           Option beginning on the first anniversary of the\n', b'                           Grant Date and as to an additional one-third on each\n', b'                           of the second and third anniversaries of the Grant\n', b'                           Date (each twelve month period ending on an\n', b'                           anniversary of a Grant Date being referred to herein\n', b'                           as an "Option Year"), provided in each case that the\n', b'                           Participant shall have remained an employee or a\n', b'                           director of the Company (or a subsidiary), or in the\n', b'                           case of a Designated Other, shall have remained in\n', b'                           the position set forth in the Stock Option Agreement,\n', b'                           continuously since the Grant Date. Notwithstanding\n', b'                           the foregoing, during the remaining term of any\n', b'                           options (if not already so exercisable) : (A) if a\n', b"                           Participant's employment or service as a director, or\n", b'                           in the case of a Designated Other, the period of\n', b'                           service as defined in the Stock Option Agreement,\n', b'                           terminates due to death, all Options held by the\n', b'                           Participant at death shall become immediately\n', b'                           exercisable in full; (B) upon a Change in Control,\n', b'                           all Options held by such Participant who is then an\n', b'                           employee or director of the Company (or a subsidiary)\n', b'                           shall become immediately exercisable in full; and (C)\n', b'                           in the event that the exercisability of an Option\n', b'                           accelerates due to a Change in Control, Participants\n', b'                           who are subject to Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act\n', b'                           may not sell the shares acquired upon such\n', b'                           accelerated exercise within six months of the Grant\n', b'                           Date of such Option.\n', b'\n', b'                  (iv)     Except to the extent permitted by Rule 16b-3 or its\n', b'                           successor, Options shall not be sold, assigned,\n', b'                           transferred, pledged, hypothecated, or otherwise\n', b'                           disposed of, except by will or the laws of descent\n', b'                           and distribution, pursuant to a qualified domestic\n', b'                           relations order ("QDRO") as defined in the Code or\n', b'                           ERISA (or the rules thereunder) or as otherwise set\n', b'                           forth in this Section 4(a)(iv). Each Option shall be\n', b'                           exercisable during the lifetime of a Participant only\n', b'                           by the Participant to whom it was granted, and after\n', b"                           the Participant's death only by the Participant's\n", b'                           estate or legal representative. To the extent\n', b'                           exercisable, an Option may be exercised in whole at\n', b'                           any time, or in part from time to time, during the\n', b'                           term of the Option.\n', b'\n', b'                  (v)      Any Option may be converted, modified, forfeited or\n', b'                           canceled, prospectively or retroactively, in whole or\n', b'                           in part, by the Committee in its sole discretion;\n', b'                           provided, phowever, that no such action shall\n', b'                           adversely affect the rights of any Participant under\n', b'                           any\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                        3\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                           Option granted prior to such action without his\n', b'                           consent. Except as may be otherwise provided in an\n', b'                           Agreement, the Committee may, in its sole discretion,\n', b'                           in whole or in part, waive any restrictions or\n', b'                           conditions applicable to, or accelerate the vesting\n', b'                           of, any Option.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      STOCK AWARDS.\n', b'\n', b'                  (i)      Upon the grant of a Restricted Stock Award, a stock\n', b'                           certificate representing a number of shares of Stock\n', b'                           equal to the number of shares of Restricted Stock\n', b'                           granted to a Participant shall be registered in the\n', b"                           Participant's name but shall be held in custody by\n", b"                           the Company for the Participant's account. The\n", b'                           Participant shall generally have the rights and\n', b'                           privileges of a stockholder as to such Restricted\n', b'                           Stock, including the right to vote such Restricted\n', b'                           Stock, except that the following restrictions (the\n', b'                           "Restrictions") shall apply: (A) the Participant\n', b'                           shall not be entitled to delivery of the certificate\n', b'                           until the Restricted Period (set forth in paragraph\n', b'                           (iii) below) applicable to such Restricted Stock has\n', b'                           expired or terminated and until any other conditions\n', b'                           prescribed by the Committee are satisfied; (B) none\n', b'                           of the Restricted Stock may be sold, transferred,\n', b'                           assigned, pledged, or otherwise encumbered or\n', b'                           disposed of during the Restricted Period applicable\n', b'                           to such Restricted Stock and prior to the\n', b'                           satisfaction of any other conditions prescribed by\n', b'                           the Committee; and (C) shares of Restricted Stock\n', b'                           shall be forfeited and all rights of the Participant\n', b'                           to such Restricted Stock shall terminate without\n', b'                           further obligation on the part of the Company unless\n', b'                           the Participant has (1) remained an employee or a\n', b'                           director of the Company (or a subsidiary) until the\n', b'                           expiration or termination of the Restricted Period\n', b'                           applicable to such Restricted Stock (or in the case\n', b'                           of a Designated Other, the duration specified in the\n', b'                           Restricted Stock Award Agreement) and (2) satisfied\n', b'                           any other conditions prescribed by the Committee\n', b'                           applicable to such Restricted Stock. At the\n', b'                           discretion of the Committee, cash and stock dividends\n', b'                           with respect to the Restricted Stock may be either\n', b'                           currently paid or withheld by the Company for the\n', b"                           Participant's account. Cash dividends so withheld by\n", b'                           the Committee shall not be subject to forfeiture.\n', b'                           Upon the forfeiture of any shares of Restricted\n', b'                           Stock, such forfeited Restricted Stock shall be\n', b'                           transferred to the Company without further action by\n', b'                           the Participant. The Participant shall have the same\n', b'                           rights and privileges, and be subject to the\n', b'                           Restrictions, with respect to any shares or other\n', b'                           property received pursuant to Section 9.\n', b'\n', b'                  (ii)     Upon the expiration or termination of the Restricted\n', b'                           Period with respect to shares of Restricted Stock and\n', b'                           the satisfaction of any other conditions prescribed\n', b'                           by the Committee, the Restrictions applicable to such\n', b'                           Restricted Stock shall lapse and a stock certificate\n', b'                           for the number of shares of Stock with respect to\n', b'                           which the Restricted Period has lapsed shall be\n', b'                           delivered, free of all restrictions, except any that\n', b'                           may be imposed by law, to the Participant or the\n', b"                           Participant's beneficiary or estate, as the case may\n", b'                           be. The Company shall not be required to deliver any\n', b'                           fractional share of Stock but will pay, in lieu\n', b'                           thereof, the Fair Market Value (determined as of the\n', b'                           date the Restricted Period expires or terminates) of\n', b'                           such fractional share to the Participant or the\n', b"                           Participant's beneficiary or estate, as the case may\n", b'                           be. No payment will be required from the Participant\n', b'                           upon the issuance or delivery of any shares of Stock\n', b'                           under this paragraph, except that any amount\n', b'                           necessary to satisfy applicable federal, state or\n', b'                           local tax requirements shall be withheld or paid\n', b'                           promptly upon notification of the amount due and\n', b'                           prior to or concurrently with the issuance or\n', b'                           delivery of a certificate representing such shares.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                        4\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  (iii)    Unless otherwise specified by the Committee at the\n', b'                           time of the award and included in the Restricted\n', b'                           Stock Award Agreement, the Restrictions shall also\n', b'                           lapse with respect to one- third of the Restricted\n', b'                           Stock subject to all other Restricted Stock Awards on\n', b'                           each of the first through the third anniversaries of\n', b'                           the Grant Date, provided in each case that the\n', b'                           Participant shall have remained an employee or a\n', b'                           director of the Company (or a subsidiary)\n', b'                           continuously since the date of grant (or in the case\n', b'                           of a Designated Other, shall have complied with the\n', b'                           terms and conditions of the Restricted Stock Award\n', b'                           Agreement). Notwithstanding the foregoing: (A) if a\n', b"                           Participant's employment or service as a director, or\n", b'                           in the case of a Designated Other, the period defined\n', b'                           in the Restricted Stock Award Agreement, terminates\n', b'                           due to death, the Restrictions shall lapse with\n', b'                           respect to all Restricted Stock Awards held by the\n', b'                           Participant at death (if not already so lapsed); (B)\n', b'                           upon a Change in Control, the Restrictions shall\n', b'                           lapse with respect to all Restricted Stock Awards\n', b'                           held by such Participant who is an employee or\n', b'                           director of the Company (or a subsidiary) (if not\n', b'                           already so lapsed); and (C) in the event of an\n', b'                           accelerated lapse of Restrictions due to a Change in\n', b'                           Control, Participants who are subject to Section\n', b'                           16(b) of the Exchange Act may not sell the shares of\n', b'                           Stock whose Restrictions have so lapsed within six\n', b'                           months of the Grant Date of the Restricted Stock\n', b'                           Award pursuant to which such Stock was received. The\n', b'                           "Restricted Period" as to any shares constituting\n', b'                           part of a Restricted Stock Award shall be the period\n', b'                           of time commencing with the Grant Date of a\n', b'                           Restricted Stock Award and ending with the date on\n', b'                           which the Restrictions lapse with respect to any such\n', b'                           shares, or any portion thereof.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      In the event that the acceleration of (i) the exercisability\n', b'                  of an Option or (ii) the lapse of Restrictions relating to\n', b'                  Restricted Stock upon a Change in Control and a Change in\n', b'                  Status results in excise tax pursuant to Section 4999 of the\n', b'                  Code, or any successor or similar provision thereto, or\n', b'                  comparable state or local tax laws, the Company shall pay to\n', b'                  the Participant such additional compensation as is necessary\n', b'                  (after taking into account all Federal, state and local income\n', b'                  and excise taxes payable by the Participant as a result of the\n', b'                  receipt of such compensation ) to place the Participant in the\n', b'                  same after-tax position he would have been in had no such\n', b'                  excise tax (or any interest or penalties thereon) been paid or\n', b'                  incurred. The amount of such payment shall be determined by\n', b"                  the independent accounting firm serving as the Company's\n", b'                  outside auditor immediately prior to the Change in Control.\n', b'\n', b'5.       EXERCISE OF OPTIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      The Exercise Price of the shares purchasable under an Option\n', b'                  shall be the Fair Market Value per share on the Grant Date of\n', b'                  such Option, subject to subsequent adjustment pursuant to the\n', b'                  provisions of Section 9.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      Options shall be considered exercised (herein the "Exercise\n', b'                  Date") on the date written notice, in such form as the\n', b'                  Committee may prescribe, is received by the Option Plan\n', b'                  Administrator of the Company, advising of the exercise of an\n', b'                  Option and either transmitting payment of the total Exercise\n', b'                  Price for the number of shares of Stock involved or electing\n', b'                  one of the alternative payment procedures set forth in Section\n', b'                  5(c) below.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      The Exercise Price shall be paid in cash (including cash\n', b'                  obtained through a margin loan on the shares as to which the\n', b'                  Option is being exercised) or (and provided (x) the use of the\n', b'                  following procedure by a Participant would comply with\n', b'                  safeguards established by the Committee designed to\n', b'\n', b'                                        5\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  to avoid "short-swing" profits to the Participant under\n', b'                  Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act, and (y) does not otherwise\n', b'                  violate any applicable laws) through (i) a broker-assisted\n', b'                  cashless exercise program established by the Committee, based\n', b'                  on the actual proceeds from the sale of share of Stock; or\n', b'                  (ii) in shares of Stock, valued on the basis of the closing\n', b'                  market price of the Stock on the Exercise Date.\n', b'\n', b'         (d)      Subject to the provisions of Section 6 and the other\n', b'                  provisions of the Plan, the Stock Option Agreement and the\n', b'                  Option, the Company shall issue shares of Stock in the\n', b"                  Participant's name as soon as practicable (but in no event\n", b'                  later than 30 days) after the Exercise Date. The Participant\n', b'                  shall not be deemed to be a holder of any shares pursuant to\n', b'                  an Option, and shall not have any rights as a stockholder in\n', b'                  connection with such shares, until the date of transfer of\n', b'                  shares of Stock to the Participant. The Company shall have no\n', b'                  liability of any nature whatsoever to any Participant by\n', b'                  reason of any change in the market price of the Stock during\n', b'                  the period of time between the Exercise Date and the date on\n', b'                  which any shares of Stock resulting from the exercise are\n', b'                  issued or sold.\n', b'\n', b'6.       RESTRICTIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan, an Option or\n', b'                  Restricted Stock Award to the contrary, no Option shall be\n', b'                  exercised, and the Company shall not be obligated to issue or\n', b'                  transfer shares of Stock under any Option or Restricted Stock\n', b'                  Award, until the Company shall have received such assurances\n', b'                  as the Company may reasonably request from its counsel that\n', b'                  the exercise of the Option and the issuance and transfer of\n', b'                  shares pursuant to the Option or Restricted Stock Award will\n', b'                  not violate the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or any\n', b'                  other applicable Federal or state laws. b"                  Company, in respect of the Participant's investment intent or\n", b'                  such other matters as counsel to the Company may deem\n', b'                  necessary or desirable to assure compliance with all\n', b'                  applicable legal requirements.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      No provisions of the Plan or any Option or Restricted Stock\n', b'                  Award shall be interpreted or construed to obligate the\n', b'                  Company to register any Stock under Federal or state law.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      The Company and the Committee reserve the right to investigate\n', b'                  at any time the circumstances surrounding any exercise of\n', b'                  Options, including any investigation regarding whether a\n', b'                  Participant is in compliance with the provisions of Section 13\n', b'                  hereof (or has threatened or is reasonably believed to intend\n', b'                  to violate the provisions of Section 13 hereof), and the\n', b'                  Company and the Committee shall have no liability or\n', b'                  responsibility to any Participant for any alleged damage\n', b'                  sustained by the Participant by reason of any delay in the\n', b'                  implementation of an Option exercise during the pendency of\n', b'                  any such investigation, whether by reason of any change in the\n', b'                  market price of the Stock or otherwise.\n', b'\n', b'         (d)      Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, the Committee\n', b'                  shall have the right at any time to deny or delay a\n', b"                  Participant's exercise of Options if such Participant is\n", b'                  reasonably believed by the Committee (i) to be engaged in\n', b'                  material conduct adversely affecting the Company or (ii) to be\n', b'                  contemplating such conduct, unless and until the Committee\n', b'                  shall have received reasonable assurance that the Participant\n', b'                  is not engaged in, and is not contemplating, such material\n', b'                  conduct adverse to the interests of the Company.\n', b'\n', b'                                       6\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'         (e) FAIR MARKET VALUE.\n', b'\n', b"         (a)      During any period that the Company's Stock is Actively Traded,\n", b'                  Fair Market Value shall be equal to the average selling price\n', b'                  of a share of Stock on the exchange or national market system\n', b'                  on which the Stock is traded, on the date of grant of an\n', b'                  option to acquire Stock pursuant to the Plan, or pursuant to\n', b'                  such other method as the Committee may reasonably specify for\n', b"                  determining the Stock's Fair Market Value.\n", b'\n', b"         (b)      During any period during which the Company's Stock is not\n", b'                  Actively Traded, Fair Market Value shall be determined by the\n', b'                  Committee.\n', b'\n', b'8.       TERM.\n', b'\n', b'         This Amended and Restated Plan shall be effective as of the date set\n', b'         forth on the first page hereof. No Option or Restricted Stock Award\n', b'         shall be granted under the Plan after February 12, 2006, but the Plan\n', b'         shall continue in effect thereafter with respect to any previously\n', b'         granted Options and Restricted Stock Awards that remain outstanding and\n', b'         the duration of any such grant or award shall not be affected by the\n', b'         expiration of the Plan.\n', b'\n', b'9.       ADJUSTMENTS.\n', b'\n', b'         In the event that any recapitalization, or reclassification, split-up\n', b'         or consolidation of shares of Stock shall be effected, or the\n', b'         outstanding shares of Stock shall, in connection with a merger or\n', b'         consolidation of the Company or a transaction or series of related\n', b'         transactions that results in the sale of all or substantially all of\n', b"         the Company's assets, be exchanged for a different number or class of\n", b'         shares of stock or other securities or property of the Company or any\n', b'         other Person, or a record date or dates for determination of holders of\n', b'         Stock entitled to receive a dividend payable in stock or a liquidating\n', b'         dividend (or series of dividends) shall occur, equitable and\n', b'         proportional adjustments aimed at preventing the inequitable\n', b'         enlargement or dilution of any rights hereunder shall be made to (i)\n', b'         the number and class of shares or other securities or property that may\n', b'         be issued or transferred pursuant to the Plan and any outstanding\n', b'         Options and Restricted Stock Awards and (ii) the Exercise Price to be\n', b'         paid per share under any outstanding Options; GENERAL PROVISIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         (a)      Nothing in this Plan or in any instrument executed pursuant\n', b'                  hereto shall confer upon any Person any right to continue in\n', b'                  the employment or other service of the Company (or any\n', b'                  subsidiary), or shall affect the right of the Company (or any\n', b'                  subsidiary) to terminate the employment or other service of\n', b'                  any person at any time with or without Cause.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      The Company may make appropriate provisions for the\n', b'                  withholding of any taxes which the Company determines it is\n', b'                  required to withhold in connection with any Option or\n', b'                  Restricted Stock Award including, at the request of a\n', b'                  Participant and provided that it does not violate any\n', b'                  applicable \n', b'\n', b'                                       8\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  laws, the payment of such withholding taxes through a\n', b'                  broker-assisted sale of a sufficient number of shares\n', b'                  underlying the Option or subject to the Restricted Stock Award\n', b'                  or by delivery to the Company of shares of Stock previously\n', b'                  owned by the Participant, in either case having an actual sale\n', b'                  price equal to the amount of such taxes. Notwithstanding the\n', b'                  foregoing, a Participant whose transactions in Stock are\n', b'                  subject to Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act may make a share\n', b'                  withholding election only if it complies with safeguards\n', b'                  established by the Committee designed to avoid "short swing"\n', b'                  profits to the Participant under Section 16(b) of the Exchange\n', b'                  Act. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-COMPETITION; CONDUCT NOT IN THE INTEREST OF THE\n', b'         CORPORATION.\n', b'\n', b'         By accepting Options or Restricted Stock Awards under the Plan and as a\n', b'         condition to the exercise of Options and the enjoyment of any of the\n', b'         benefits of the Plan, each Participant agrees as follows:\n', b'\n', b"         (a)      CONFIDENTIALITY -- During the period of each Participant's\n", b'                  employment or service as a director with the Company (or the\n', b"                  Participant's engaging in any other activity with or for the\n", b'                  Company) and for a two year period thereafter, each\n', b'                  Participant shall treat and safeguard as confidential and\n', b'                  secret all Confidential Information received by such\n', b'                  Participant at any time. Without the prior written consent of\n', b'                  the Company, except as required by law, such Participant will\n', b'                  not disclose or reveal any Confidential Information to any\n', b'                  third party whatsoever or use the same in any manner except in\n', b'                  connection with the businesses of the Company and its\n', b'                  subsidiaries. In the event that a Participant is requested or\n', b'                  required (by oral questions, interrogatories, requests for\n', b'                  information or documents, subpoena, civil investigative demand\n', b'                  or other process) to disclose (i) any Confidential Information\n', b'                  or (ii) any information relating to his opinion, judgment or\n', b'                  recommendations concerning the Company or its subsidiaries as\n', b'                  developed from the Confidential Information, Participant will\n', b'                  provide the Company with prompt written notice of any such\n', b'                  request or requirement so that the Company may seek an\n', b'                  appropriate protective order or waive compliance with the\n', b'                  provisions contained herein. If, failing the entry of a\n', b'                  protective order or the receipt of a waiver hereunder,\n', b'                  Participant is, in the reasonable opinion of his counsel,\n', b'                  compelled to disclose Confidential Information, Participant\n', b'                  shall disclose only that portion of the Confidential\n', b'                  Information which his counsel advises that he is compelled to\n', b'                  disclose and will exercise best efforts to obtain assurances\n', b'                  that confidential treatment will be accorded such Confidential\n', b'                  Information.\n', b'\n', b'         (b)      NON-COMPETITION -- During the period of employment with the\n', b'                  Company or its subsidiaries of any Participant (other than a\n', b'                  director) compensated at a rate (including bonuses) in excess\n', b'                  of $75,000 per year in cash compensation from his employment\n', b'                  with the Company or any of its subsidiaries (determined as of\n', b'                  the most recently completed fiscal year of the Company), and,\n', b'                  for a two-year period thereafter (the "Non-Compete Period"),\n', b'                  each such Participant shall not, without prior written consent\n', b'                  of the Committee, do, directly or indirectly, any of the\n', b'                  following:\n', b'\n', b'                  (1)      own, manage, control or participate in the ownership,\n', b'                           management, or control of, or be employed or engaged\n', b'                           by or otherwise affiliated or associated with, any\n', b'                           other corporation, partnership, proprietorship, firm,\n', b'                           association or other business entity, or otherwise\n', b'                           engage in any business which competes with the\n', b'                           business of the Company or any of its subsidiaries\n', b'                           (as such business is conducted during the term of\n', b"                           such Participant's employment with the Company or its\n", b'                           subsidiaries) in the geographical regions in which\n', b'                           such business is conducted; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that\n', b'                           the ownership of a maximum of one percent of the\n', b'                           outstanding stock of any publicly traded corporation\n', b'                           shall not violate this covenant; or\n', b'\n', b'                  (2)      employ, solicit for employment or assist in employing\n', b'                           or soliciting for employment any present, former or\n', b'                           future employee, officer or agent of the Company or\n', b'                           any of its subsidiaries.\n', b'\n', b'                  In the event any court of competent jurisdiction should\n', b'                  determine that the foregoing covenant of non-competition is\n', b'                  not enforceable because of the extent of the geographical area\n', b'                  or the duration \n', b'\n', b'                                       10\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  thereof, then the Company and the affected Participant hereby\n', b'                  petition such court to modify the foregoing covenant to the\n', b'                  extent, but only to the extent, necessary to create a covenant\n', b'                  which is enforceable in the opinion of such court, with the\n', b'                  intention of the parties that the Company shall be afforded\n', b'                  the maximum enforceable covenant of non-competition which may\n', b'                  be available under the circumstances and applicable law.\n', b'\n', b'         (c)      Each Participant acknowledges that remedies at law for any\n', b'                  breach by him of this section 13 may be inadequate and that\n', b'                  the damages resulting from any such breach are not readily\n', b'                  susceptible to being measured in monetary terms.                SUNBEAM BONUS PLAN\n', b'\n', b'ELIGIBILITY: All exempt and non-exempt salaried employees. Note: "hourly"\n', b'production workers, Operating Committee members and certain other executives are\n', b'not eligible to participate. Additionally, any employee hired after October 1\n', b'will not be eligible until the following year.\n', b'\n', b'PLAN DESIGN: 1. Each fiscal year, the Operating Committee will establish a\n', b'minimum level of acceptable performance, below which the Bonus Pool will be\n', b'zero. Performance of the corporation will be expressed in terms of Earnings Per\n', b'Share (EPS).\n', b'\n', b'             2. All payouts under the Plan as well as Plan parameters are fully\n', b'discretionary and any payments under the Plan must be authorized by the\n', b'Operating Committee.\n', b'\n', b'             3. All payments will be in cash, paid during the first quarter\n', b'following the end of the fiscal year, to all eligible participants actively\n', b'employed at the time of the payment.\n', b'\n', b'TARGET BONUS\n', b'\n', b"POOL: The target bonus pool will be the sum total of each participant's target\n", b'bonus amount. The actual earned bonus pool will be determined at fiscal year end\n', b'by comparing actual financial performance to targeted performance as determined\n', b'by the Corporate Business Plan. No bonuses will be paid if the Company fails to\n', b'reach its minimum objectives.\n', b'\n', b'TARGET PAYOUTS:   EXEMPT - a percentage of base earnings\n', b'\n', b'                  NON-EXEMPT - a flat dollar amount (prorated for partial -year\n', b'                               service)\n', b'\n', b'PAYOUT\n', b'PARAMETERS:                1. below minimum performance standard = 0\n', b'                                            payout\n', b'                           2. target minimum payout threshold = 75% of target\n', b'                           3. target maximum payout limit = 200% of target\n', b'\n', b'                           Individual Payouts\n', b'\n', b'                           1. four (4) quantitative objectives established for\n', b'                              each employee\n', b'                           2. objectives reviewed by supervisor\n', b'                           3. payout will be determined by a combination of\n', b'                              Company EPS performance and individual performance\n', b'                              against mutually agreed upon goals & objectives\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                             1998 SUNBEAM BONUS PLAN\n', b'                             Self Funding Structure\n', b'\n', b'===============================================================================\n', b'EPS*                                    Available % of Target Bonus\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$1.89 or less                           0%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$1.90 - $2.04                           75%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.05 - $2.19                           85%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.20 - $2.29                           100%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.30 - $2.39                           120%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.40 - $2.49                           140%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.50 - $2.59                           160%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.60 - $2.69                           180%\n', b'- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n', b'$2.70 or more                           200%\n', b'===============================================================================\n', b'* Earnings per share (EPS): Basically, net sales minus total cost of doing\n', b'business (overhead, materials, direct labor) equals operating profit. Operating\n', b'profit minus taxes and debt expense equals net earnings. Net earnings divided by\n', b'outstanding shares of stock equals EPS.\n', b'\n', b'What does this mean to me? If our sales go up and/or if our expenses and debt\n', b'are reduced, then earnings per share (and the value of Sunbeam stock) goes up.\n', b'\n', b'EXAMPLES:\n', b'\n', b'At the end of 1998, the EPS is $2.25. 100% of the target bonus is available for\n', b'payout.\n', b'\n', b'If the EPS is $1.75, then our minimum threshold is not reached and no bonuses\n', b'will be paid.\n', b'\n', b'If the EPS is $2.75, then the maximum 200% of target bonus will be available for\n', b'payout.\n', b'\n', b'Remember, once the Company performance has established the AVAILABLE bonus\n', b'amount (e.g., 100% of target in our first example and 200% of target in our\n', b'third example), your INDIVIDUAL bonus will be determined by your performance on\n', b'your four (4) objectives.\n', b'\n', b'All awards are discretionary and must be approved by the Operating Committee.\n', b'\n', b'</TEXT>\n', b'</DOCUMENT>\n', b'<DOCUMENT>\n', b'<TYPE>EX-10.Q\n', b'<SEQUENCE>8\n', b'<TEXT>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                                                   EXHIBIT 10.q\n', b'\n', b'                           THIRD AMENDMENT dated as of November 6, 1997 (this\n', b'                           "Amendment") to the Credit Agreement dated as of\n', b'                           September 16, 1996 (as amended, the "Credit\n', b'                           Agreement"), among SUNBEAM CORPORATION (the\n', b'                           "Company"), the BORROWING SUBSIDIARIES (as defined\n', b'                           therein), - the LENDERS (as defined therein), and THE\n', b'                           CHASE MANHATTAN BANK, as Administrative Agent.\n', b'\n', b'         A. DEFINITIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         Unless otherwise defined herein, all capitalized terms shall have the\n', b'meanings set forth in the Receivables Purchase and Servicing Agreement (the\n', b'"RECEIVABLES PURCHASE AGREEMENT") dated as of December 4, 1997, by and among\n', b'Funding, as Seller, Llama Retail Funding, L.P., as Purchaser, Capital USA,\n', b'L.L.C., as Administrative Agent and the Parent, in its individual capacity and\n', b'as Servicer.\n', b'\n', b'         Section 2.  AGREEMENT TO TRANSFER.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) The Parent hereby agrees, on each Weekly Settlement Date (as\n', b'defined below), to sell, transfer, absolutely assign, set-over, convey and/or\n', b'contribute to the capital of Funding, all Receivables of each Designated Obligor\n', b'owned by the Parent as of the close of business on the immediately preceding\n', b'Weekly Settlement Date. The Parent and Funding shall enter into a certificate of\n', b'assignment (the "SALE ASSIGNMENT"), dated as of the date hereof, in the form of\n', b'Exhibit A hereto, evidencing such sale, transfer, absolute assignment, set-over,\n', b'conveyance and/or contribution of such Receivables by the Parent to Funding.\n', b'Each Receivable so sold, transferred, absolutely assigned, conveyed, set-over\n', b'and/or contributed to Funding is referred to herein as a "SOLD RECEIVABLE."\n', b'\n', b'         (b) On the first Business Day of each week or such other day of the\n', b'week as agreed to from time to time by the Parent and Funding (each, a "WEEKLY\n', b'SETTLEMENT DATE"), Funding shall pay the Parent in respect of all Sold\n', b'Receivables constituting (as of the date such Receivable was transferred to\n', b'Funding) Eligible Receivables sold, transferred, absolutely assigned, conveyed\n', b'or set-over to Funding during the week immediately preceding such Weekly\n', b'Settlement Date an amount (the "Sale Price") equal to the lesser of (i) the cash\n', b'received by Funding on such day in respect of its financing of such Eligible\n', b'Receivables and (ii) the fair market value of such Eligible Receivables. To the\n', b'extent that the Sale Price for such Eligible Receivables is less than the fair\n', b'market value thereof, the difference shall be deemed a capital contribution by\n', b'the Parent to Funding. The Sale Price shall be payable by Funding in full by\n', b'wire transfer on each Weekly Settlement Date to an account designated by the\n', b'Parent on or before such Weekly Settlement Date. The fair market value of each\n', b'Sold Receivable that, as of the date such Receivable was transferred to Funding,\n', b'did not constitute an Eligible Receivable shall be deemed a capital contribution\n', b'by the Parent to Funding.\n', b'\n', b'                                       2\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'         (c) Upon the sale, transfer, absolute assignment, set-over, conveyance\n', b'and/or contribution of the Sold Receivables the ownership of each such\n', b'Receivable shall be vested in Funding and the Parent shall not take any action\n', b'inconsistent with such ownership and shall not claim any ownership interest in\n', b'any such Sold Receivable.\n', b'\n', b'         (d) The Parent shall indicate in its Records that ownership of each\n', b'Sold Receivable is held by Funding or its assignee. In addition, the Parent\n', b'shall respond to any inquiries with respect to ownership of a Sold Receivable by\n', b'stating that it is no longer the owner of such Receivable and that ownership of\n', b'such Sold Receivable is held by Funding or its assignee.\n', b'\n', b'         (e) The Parent shall provide for the direct remittance by each Obligor\n', b'of all Collections with respect to each Sold Receivable to the account specified\n', b'to it by the Administrative Agent.\n', b'\n', b'         (f) Until such time as it is notified that Funding has transferred\n', b'ownership of a Sold Receivable or it is otherwise directed by Funding, the\n', b'Parent shall conduct the servicing, administration and collection of such Sold\n', b'Receivable and shall take, or cause to be taken, all such actions as may be\n', b'necessary or advisable to service, administer and collect such Sold Receivable,\n', b'from time to time, all in accordance with (i) customary and prudent servicing\n', b'procedures for receivables of a similar type, (ii) all applicable laws, rules\n', b'and regulations, and (iii) without limitation as to its obligations under the\n', b'preceding clauses (i) and (ii), no less a standard of care than that which it\n', b'applies to Receivables it services for its own account.\n', b'\n', b'         Section 3.               WHEREAS, the Seller desires to sell certain trade receivables\n', b'originated by the Originator from time to time and the Purchaser desires to\n', b'purchase such trade receivables in accordance with the terms of this Agreement;\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the Administrative Agent has been requested and is\n', b'willing to provide certain administrative services on behalf of the Purchaser in\n', b'connection with the making and financing of such purchases;\n', b'\n', b'                  WHEREAS, the Purchaser desires that a Servicer be appointed to\n', b'service receivables purchased by the Purchaser under this Agreement and the\n', b'Originator has been requested and is willing to act as the Servicer;\n', b'\n', b'                  NOW, THEREFORE, the parties agree as follows:\n', b'\n', b'                                    ARTICLE I\n', b'\n', b'                                   DEFINITIONS\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 1.1. CERTAIN DEFINED TERMS.\n', b'\n', b'         Defined terms used herein shall have the meanings set forth in Annex I\n', b'hereto.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 1.2. OTHER TERMS.\n', b'\n', b'         All accounting terms not specifically defined herein shall be construed\n', b'in accordance with GAAP. All terms used in Article 9 of the UCC of the State of\n', b'New York, and not specifically defined herein, are used herein as defined in\n', b'such Article 9. All hourly references herein shall refer to New York City time.\n', b'Except as otherwise indicated, all agreements defined in this Agreement refer to\n', b'the same as from time to time amended or supplemented.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                   ARTICLE II\n', b'\n', b'                             PURCHASE OF RECEIVABLES\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.1. FACILITY.\n', b'\n', b'         The Purchaser may, on the terms and conditions set forth herein, and in\n', b'its sole discretion, make Purchases of Receivables Interests from the Seller.\n', b'Purchases may be made until the occurrence of the Purchase Termination Date. The\n', b'Purchaser will not make any Purchase if, after giving effect to such Purchase,\n', b'the aggregate Capital Investment for all Receivables Interests hereunder would\n', b'exceed the Purchase Limit. Nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to be or\n', b'construed as a commitment by the Purchaser to purchase any Receivables Interest.\n', b'In the event the Purchaser is not able to make a Purchase that it otherwise has\n', b'agreed to make solely as a result of a CP Disruption Event, the Purchaser will,\n', b'to the extent an advance is permitted to be made under the Liquidity Agreement,\n', b'request such an advance under the Liquidity Agreement and, upon receipt of the\n', b'proceeds of such advance, will make such Purchase in an amount equal to the\n', b'amount of such advance.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.2. MAKING PURCHASES FROM THE SELLER.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) Purchases that the Purchaser agrees to make will be made on\n', b'Purchase Dates. A Purchase will only be made if the Seller has delivered a\n', b'Request Notice to the Administrative Agent by 1:00 p.m. on the Business Day\n', b'immediately prior to the requested Purchase Date.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) The Administrative Agent, on behalf of the Purchaser, will promptly\n', b"notify the Seller of the Purchaser's decision to make a Purchase or not to make\n", b'a Purchase and, if so, whether the amount specified by the Seller in the Request\n', b'Notice is acceptable to the Purchaser. Each notification will be made by\n', b'delivery of a Purchase Notification on the related Purchase Date to the Seller.\n', b'\n', b'         (c) On the date of a Purchase, the Administrative Agent on behalf of\n', b'the Purchaser shall, upon satisfaction of the Purchase Conditions, make\n', b'available to the Collection Account the Capital Investment for such Receivables\n', b'Interest (as set forth in related Purchase Notification, which amount may be\n', b'reduced by any amounts due under Sections 2.10, 8.1 or 10.3 that remain unpaid\n', b'on such day of Purchase) in same day funds, which amount shall be made\n', b'immediately available to the Seller at the account of the Seller specified in\n', b'writing to the Administrative Agent by the Seller from time to time.\n', b'\n', b'         (d) Effective on the date of each Purchase pursuant to this Section\n', b'2.2, the Seller hereby sells and assigns to the Purchaser an undivided\n', b'percentage ownership interest, to the extent of the Receivables Interest then\n', b'being purchased, in each Pool Receivable then existing and in the Related\n', b'Security and Collections with respect thereto.\n', b'\n', b'                                       2\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.3. RECEIVABLES INTEREST.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) The Administrative Agent will calculate the Receivables Interest\n', b'purchased on each Purchase Date and shall, on such Purchase Date, combine such\n', b'Receivables Interest, pursuant to the provisions of Section 2.4, with any\n', b'outstanding Receivables Interest and calculate the combined Receivable Interest,\n', b'after giving effect to the Purchase made on that Purchase Date, and notify the\n', b'Seller of the combined Receivables Interest in the Purchase Notification. The\n', b'undivided percentage interest of any Receivables Interest is equal to the\n', b'percentage equivalent of a fraction:\n', b'\n', b'                                    CI + R\n', b'                                    ------\n', b'                                     NRPB\n', b'\n', b'                              where:\n', b'\n', b'                  CI       = the Capital Investment on the date the Receivables\n', b'                           Interest is calculated.\n', b'\n', b'                  R        = the sum of the Applicable Margin Reserve, the\n', b'                           Dilution Reserve, the Fee Reserve and the Yield\n', b'                           Reserve, each on the date the Receivables Interest is\n', b'                           calculated.\n', b'\n', b'                  NRPB     = The Net Receivables Pool Balance on the date the\n', b'                           Receivables Interest is calculated.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) A Receivables Interest shall become zero on the later to occur of\n', b'(a) the date the Purchaser shall have (i) received the Accrued Daily Yield for\n', b'such Receivables Interest, plus any amount reasonably allocated by the\n', b'Administrative Agent in respect of the discount on Commercial Paper and the\n', b'interest on Liquidity Loans to mature after the date the Receivables Interest\n', b'becomes zero, (ii) recovered its Capital Investment and (iii) received all other\n', b'amounts payable to the Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement, and (b) the date\n', b'the Servicer shall have received the accrued Servicing Fee for such Receivables\n', b'Interest. A Receivables Interest shall remain constant until the next Purchase\n', b'Date on which a Purchase is made and shall remain constant at all times on and\n', b'after the Purchase Termination Date.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.4. DIVIDING OR COMBINING RECEIVABLES INTEREST.\n', b'\n', b'         The Administrative Agent may at any time either (i) divide any\n', b'Receivables Interests into two or more Receivables Interests having aggregate\n', b'Capital Investment equal to the Capital Investment of such divided Receivables\n', b'Interest, or (ii) combine any two or more Receivables Interest into a single\n', b'Receivables Interest having Capital Investment equal to the aggregate of the\n', b'Capital Investment of such original Receivables Interests.\n', b'\n', b'                                       3\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.5. ESTABLISHMENT OF COLLECTION ACCOUNT.\n', b'\n', b'         Prior to or simultaneously with the execution and delivery of this\n', b'Agreement, the Purchaser and the Administrative Agent shall establish an\n', b'Eligible Bank Account in the name of the Purchaser titled as specified in the\n', b'Receivables Purchase Agreement (the "COLLECTION ACCOUNT"). In addition, the\n', b'Administrative Agent shall establish and maintain a subaccount of the Collection\n', b'Account (the "ESCROWED AMOUNT SUBACCOUNT") into which all Escrowed Amounts shall\n', b'be deposited and retained until the expiration of the related Escrow Period.\n', b'Notwithstanding the agreement of any Obligor to deposit all amounts owing in\n', b'respect of the Pool Receivables directly to the Lockbox Account, each of the\n', b'Seller and the Servicer shall deposit all Collections it may receive in respect\n', b'of Pool Receivables into the Lockbox Account no later than the first Business\n', b'Day following the date of receipt thereof. Any Collections in respect of Pool\n', b'Receivables held by the Seller or the Servicer pending transfer to the\n', b'applicable Collection Account as provided in this Agreement shall be held in\n', b'trust for the benefit of the Purchaser until such amounts are deposited into the\n', b'applicable Collection Account.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.6. DETERMINATIONS BY THE ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT.\n', b'\n', b"         (a) The Administrative Agent's determinations and calculations made\n", b'under, or pursuant to, this Agreement shall in all cases be conclusive in the\n', b'absence of manifest error.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) On each Business Day, the Administrative Agent shall determine the\n', b'amount of Collections received on Pool Receivables. The Administrative Agent\n', b'shall notify the Purchaser, the Seller and the Servicer of its determinations\n', b'under this Section 2.6.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.7. DEPOSITS TO THE COLLECTION ACCOUNT AND THE ESCROWED\n', b'AMOUNTS SUBACCOUNT.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) On each Business Day all Collections in the Lockbox Account shall\n', b'be transferred by the Administrative Agent to the Collection Account.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) On any Business Day, the Purchaser may deposit into the Collection\n', b'Account all or a portion of the net proceeds of Commercial Paper or of any\n', b'Liquidity Loan or any other funds available to the Purchaser for deposit.\n', b'\n', b'         (c) Amounts in respect of the Escrowed Amounts shall be retained in the\n', b'Escrowed Amounts Subaccount until the expiration of the related Escrow Period at\n', b'which time such amounts shall be included in Available Funds and disbursed as\n', b'provided in Sections 2.8 and 2.9.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.8.       SECTION 2.9. LIQUIDATION SETTLEMENT PROCEDURES.\n', b'\n', b'         On each Business Day on and after the Purchase Termination Date, the\n', b'Administrative Agent shall allocate all Available Funds on deposit in the\n', b'Collection Account in the following priority (to the extent funds are available\n', b'therefor):\n', b'\n', b'         (a) to the Collateral Account, an amount equal to the sum of the\n', b'following:\n', b'\n', b'                  (i) unpaid Accrued Daily Yield through and including such\n', b'         date;\n', b'\n', b'                  (ii) the outstanding Capital Investment;\n', b'\n', b'                                       5\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                  (iii) all unpaid amounts owing by the Seller to the Purchaser\n', b'         pursuant to Sections 2.10, 8.1 or 10.3 or otherwise hereunder (other\n', b'         than Escrowed Accounts which shall be retained in the Collection\n', b'         Account until the expiration of the Escrow Period); and\n', b'\n', b'                  (iv) unpaid Accrued Daily Fees and Expenses through and\n', b'         including such date;\n', b'\n', b'         (b) to any Successor Servicer, an amount equal to any accrued and\n', b'unpaid Servicing Fee owing to such Successor Servicer;\n', b'\n', b'         (c) to the Servicer, an amount equal to the accrued and unpaid\n', b'Servicing Fee owing to the Servicer; and\n', b'\n', b'         (d) the remaining balance shall be released to the Seller.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.10. GENERAL SETTLEMENT PROCEDURES.\n', b'\n', b'         If, on any day the Outstanding Balance of any Eligible Receivable is\n', b'reduced or canceled as a result of either (i) any event giving rise to a\n', b'Dilution or (ii) a setoff in respect of any claim by the Obligor thereof against\n', b'the Seller or any Affiliate of Seller (whether such claim arises out of the same\n', b'or a related transaction or an unrelated transaction), then, the Seller shall be\n', b'deemed to have received on such day a Collection of such Receivable in the\n', b'amount of such Dilution, reduction or cancellation. If, on any day the\n', b'representations and warranties in Section 4.2 of this Agreement are no longer\n', b'true with respect to any Pool Receivable, the Seller shall be deemed to have\n', b'received on such day a Collection of such Pool Receivable in full. The Seller or\n', b'the Servicer, on behalf of the Seller, no later than the fifteenth day after\n', b'such deemed receipt, shall deposit such amount to the Collection Account for\n', b'deposit to the Escrowed Amount Subaccount; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that if a Purchase\n', b'is made by the Purchaser during such 15-day period, the Purchaser shall reduce\n', b'the Cash Purchase Price otherwise payable by it for such Purchase by the amount\n', b'of any such deemed collection, which reduction shall constitute payment in full\n', b'of such deemed collection by the Seller. If and to the extent the Purchaser\n', b'shall be required for any reason to pay over to an Obligor, any bankruptcy\n', b'trustee of any Obligor, any Obligor as debtor-in-possession or otherwise any\n', b"amount received on the Purchaser's behalf hereunder, such amount shall be deemed\n", b'not to have been so received by the Purchaser, but rather to have been retained\n', b'by the Seller and, accordingly, the Purchaser shall have a claim against the\n', b'Seller for such amount, payable when and to the extent that any distribution\n', b'from or on behalf of such Obligor is made in respect thereof. Except as\n', b'otherwise provided in this Section 2.10, or as otherwise required by applicable\n', b'law or the relevant Contract, all Collections received from an Obligor of any\n', b'Receivables shall be applied to the Receivables of such Obligor in the order of\n', b'the age of such Receivables, starting with the oldest such Receivable, unless\n', b'such Obligor designates its payment for application to specific Receivables.\n', b'\n', b'                                       6\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.11. INVESTMENT OF ACCOUNTS.\n', b'\n', b'         Subject to the provisions of this Section 2.11, amounts on deposit in\n', b'the Collection Account (including any amounts held in the Escrowed Amount\n', b'Subaccount) shall be invested in Permitted Investments. All\n', b'investment earnings shall be disbursed in the same manner and priority as all\n', b'other amounts in the Collection Account except that net investment earnings on\n', b'the Escrowed Amount Subaccount shall be deposited into the Yield Subaccount of\n', b'the Collateral Account on behalf of the Purchaser.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.12. AVAILABILITY OF INFORMATION.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) The Administrative Agent shall provide written notice,\n', b'substantially in the form of Exhibit B, to the Seller, the Servicer and the\n', b'Purchaser of the determinations and disbursements made on each Business Day,\n', b'Purchase Date and Settlement Date pursuant to this Article 2.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) In the event that the Administrative Agent is unable to obtain\n', b'information from the Seller or the Servicer with respect to any Receivable which\n', b'information is necessary for it to make the determinations set forth in Sections\n', b'2.6, 2.7 , 2.8, 2.9 or 2.10 there shall be a presumption that such Receivable\n', b'has not been paid and the Administrative Agent shall make the determinations set\n', b'forth in Section 2.6 and the allocations and distributions in Sections 2.8 and\n', b'2.9 based on such presumption. Upon such information becoming available, the\n', b'Administrative Agent shall take reasonable steps to recalculate the\n', b'determinations made subject to the presumption set forth above. The\n', b'Administrative Agent is hereby authorized to withdraw and disburse amounts from\n', b'the Lockbox Account and the Collection Account following the recalculation of\n', b'such determinations so as to achieve the same result as if disbursements of\n', b'amounts in such accounts had been made with knowledge of the correct information\n', b'in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.13. CONSTRUCTION OF AGREEMENT.\n', b'\n', b'         It is the intention of the parties hereto that the purchase and sale of\n', b'Receivables Interests from the Seller to the Purchaser be treated for all\n', b'purposes as a sale of such Receivables Interests and the proceeds thereof.\n', b'However, if a court of competent jurisdiction were to hold that the transaction\n', b'evidenced hereby is not a purchase, it is the intention of the parties hereto\n', b'that this Agreement shall constitute a security agreement under applicable law,\n', b'and that the transactions effected hereby shall be deemed to be secured\n', b'financings in each case under applicable law and, to that end, the Seller grants\n', b'to the Purchaser a first priority perfected security interest in all of the\n', b"Seller's right, title and interest in, to and under the following, whether now\n", b'existing or\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                       7\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'hereafter created: the Receivables, the Receivables Sale Agreement and all\n', b'documents and instruments executed pursuant thereto, all Collections on such\n', b'Receivables, all amounts on deposit from time to time in the Lockbox Account and\n', b'the Collection Account, all other rights relating to and payments made in\n', b'respect of this Agreement, and all proceeds of any of the foregoing.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.14. FURTHER ACTION EVIDENCING PURCHASES.\n', b'\n', b'         (a) The Seller agrees that, from time to time, at its expense, it will\n', b'promptly execute and deliver all further instruments and documents, and take all\n', b'further action, that may be necessary or appropriate, or that the Purchaser or\n', b'the Administrative Agent may reasonably request, in order to perfect, protect or\n', b'more fully evidence the transfer of ownership of the Pool Receivables or to\n', b'enable the Purchaser to exercise or enforce any of its rights hereunder. Without\n', b'limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Seller will, upon the request of\n', b'the Purchaser, (i) execute and file such financing or continuation statements,\n', b'or amendments thereto or assignments thereof, and such other instruments or\n', b'notices, as may be necessary or appropriate, or as the Purchaser may reasonably\n', b'request, and (ii) segregate all invoices of Pool Receivables and indicate by\n', b'legend and in a conspicuous manner that such invoices relate to Pool\n', b'Receivables, an interest in which has been transferred to the Purchaser. The\n', b'manner by which the Servicer segregates and legends the invoices of Pool\n', b'Receivables is subject to approval by the Administrative Agent on behalf of the\n', b'Purchaser.\n', b'\n', b'         (b) The Seller hereby authorizes the Purchaser to file one or more\n', b'financing or continuation statements, and amendments thereto and assignments\n', b'thereof, relating to all or any of the Pool Receivables and Collections with\n', b'respect thereto without the signature of the Seller.\n', b'\n', b'         SECTION 2.15. SEPARATE TRANSACTIONS.\n', b'\n', b'         The Seller, the Originator, the Purchaser and the Administrative Agent\n', b'acknowledge that the parties are entering into the transactions described in\n', b"this Agreement in reliance on the Seller's identity as a separate legal entity\n", b'from the Originator. THE HOLDINGS MERGER. Upon the terms and subject\n', b'to the conditions set forth herein, and in accordance with the DGCL, at the\n', b'Holdings Effective Time (as defined in Section 2.3 hereof), Laser Merger Sub\n', b'shall be merged with and into Holdings. The closing of the Holdings Merger (the\n', b'"CLOSING") will take place at 10:00 a.m. on a date to be specified by the\n', b'parties (the "CLOSING DATE"), which (subject to satisfaction or waiver of the\n', b'conditions set forth in Article VIII) shall be no later than the third NYSE\n', b'trading day after satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in Section\n', b'8.1, at the offices of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP, 919 Third\n', b'Avenue, New York, New York 10022, unless another time, date or place is agreed\n', b'to in writing by the parties hereto.\n', b'\n', b'                   Section 2.3. EFFECTIVE TIME OF THE HOLDINGS MERGER. The\n', b'Holdings Merger shall become effective on the date and at the time at which a\n', b'properly executed certificate of merger (the "CERTIFICATE OF MERGER") is duly\n', b'filed with the Secretary of State of the State of Delaware. The Certificate of\n', b'Merger shall be filed as soon as practicable on or after the Closing Date. When\n', b'used in this Agreement, the term "HOLDINGS EFFECTIVE TIME" shall mean the date\n', b'and time on which the Certificate of Merger is so filed.\n', b'\n', b'                   Section 2.4. CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION. BY-LAWS. DIRECTORS. Section 2.1 THE COMPANY MERGER. Upon the terms and subject to\n', b'the conditions set forth herein, and in accordance with the DGCL, at the Company\n', b'Effective Time, Merger Sub shall be merged with and into the Company. Following\n', b'the Company Effective Time, the Company shall continue as the surviving\n', b'corporation (the "SURVIVING CORPORATION"), and the separate corporate existence\n', b'of Merger Sub shall cease.                 ARTICLE I\n', b'\n', b'                                    THE OFFER\n', b'\n', b'         1.1      THE OFFER.\n', b'\n', b'                  1.1.1 GENERAL. For purposes of this Article I, the party which makes the\n', b'Offer, whether the Buyer or MergerCo, shall be referred to as the "Offeror."\n', b'Offeror may not accept any shares of Company Common Stock tendered for purchase\n', b'in response to the Offer unless it accepts all such shares that are properly\n', b'tendered in accordance with the terms thereof. Acceptance by Offeror of shares\n', b'of Company Common Stock for payment pursuant to the Offer shall be irrevocable.\n', b'The Offer shall be subject: (i) to the condition that there shall be validly\n', b'tendered in accordance with the terms of the Offer prior to the expiration date\n', b'of the Offer and not withdrawn a number of shares of Company Common Stock which,\n', b'together with the shares of Company Common Stock then owned by the Buyer and\n', b'MergerCo, represents at least 51% of the total number of outstanding shares of\n', b'the Company Common Stock, assuming the exercise of all outstanding options,\n', b'rights and convertible securities (if any) and the issuance of all shares of\n', b'Company Common Stock that the Company is then obligated to issue (such total\n', b'number of outstanding or issuable shares of Company Common Stock being\n', b'hereinafter referred to as the "Fully Diluted Shares") (the "Minimum Condition")\n', b'and (ii) to the other conditions set forth in Annex I attached hereto\n', b'(collectively, the "Offer Conditions"). The Buyer and MergerCo expressly reserve\n', b'the right to waive any of the conditions to the Offer, including but not limited\n', b'to, the satisfaction of the Minimum Condition. The initial expiration date of\n', b'the Offer shall be twenty (20) business days after commencement. Buyer and\n', b'MergerCo agree that if all of the Offer Conditions are not satisfied on such\n', b'initial expiration date of the Offer then, provided that the Offeror determines,\n', b'in its reasonable discretion that all such Conditions are reasonably capable of\n', b'being satisfied and subject to SEC rules with respect to extension of time\n', b'periods, Offeror shall extend the Offer, without consent of the Company, from\n', b'time to time until such Conditions are satisfied or waived; provided, that\n', b'Offeror shall not be required to extend the Offer beyond April 30, 1998, unless\n', b'any necessary approvals under the HSR Act (as defined herein) shall not have\n', b'been received by such date, in which case Offeror shall not be required to\n', b'extend the Offer beyond the earlier of (i) ten (10) days following receipt of\n', b'such approvals and (ii) June 30, 1998.
