Without the prior written consent of the Company, no\n', b'change may be made by Offeror which reduces the maximum number of shares of\n', b'Company Common Stock to be purchased in the Offer or which reduces the Offer\n', b'Price or changes the form of consideration or changes the Offer Conditions. The\n', b'Offer Price shall, subject to reduction for applicable withholding of taxes, be\n', b'net to the seller in cash, payable upon the terms and subject to the conditions\n', b'of the Offer. As of the Effective Time of the Merger,\n', b'by virtue of the Merger and without any action on the part of the holder of any\n', b'shares of Company Common Stock or any shares of capital stock of MergerCo:\n', b'\n', b'         (a) COMMON STOCK OF MERGERCO. Except as otherwise provided\n', b'herein and subject to Section 3.3, each issued and outstanding share of Company\n', b'Common Stock, other than shares owned by Buyer, MergerCo or any other direct or\n', b'indirect subsidiary of Buyer, the Company or any wholly owned Subsidiary of the\n', b'Company (collectively, the "Excluded Shares"), and other than Dissenting Shares\n', b'and treasury stock, shall be converted into the right to receive in cash from\n', b'the Company following the Merger an amount equal to $8.25 (the "Merger\n', b'Consideration"), without interest, upon surrender of the certificates formerly\n', b'representing such shares pursuant to Section 3.3. If, after the Effective Time of the Merger, such holder fails to perfect\n', b'or withdraws, forfeits or loses any such right to appraisal, each share of such\n', b'holder shall be treated as a share that had been converted as of the Effective\n', b'Time of the Merger into the right to receive Merger Consideration in accordance\n', b'with this Section 3.1. The Company shall give prompt notice to MergerCo of any\n', b'demands received by the Company for appraisal of shares of Company Common Stock,\n', b"and MergerCo shall have the right to participate in and, at MergerCo's\n", b'reasonable discretion, to direct all communications, negotiations and\n', b'proceedings with respect to such demands. SUNBEAM /REGISTERED TRADEMARK/\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:\n', b'\n', b'                          SUNBEAM COMPLETES RECORD YEAR\n', b'                     FOR SALES, EARNINGS & GLOBAL EXPANSION\n', b'\n', b'DELRAY BEACH, FLORIDA JANUARY 28, 1998 - Sunbeam Corporation (NYSE:SOC) today an\n', b'nounced record sales and earnings for its fourth quarter and full year 1997.\n', b'Sales for the quarter were $338 million, reflecting a 30.6% increase over the\n', b'prior year period on a comparable basis (excluding discontinued businesses and\n', b'divested product lines). Before the 1996 special charges taken by the Company to\n', b'restructure and reposition Sunbeam, earnings per share (diluted) from continuing\n', b'operations of $0.47 were $0.50 ahead of the loss of $0.03 reported in the fourth\n', b'quar ter last year. Including these charges earnings per share (diluted) rose\n', b'$2.76 above the reported $2.29 loss reported in 1996. On a year to date basis,\n', b'revenue of $1.168 billion was 22.4% above 1996 on a comparable basis and\n', b'earnings per share (diluted) from continuing operations of $1.41 was $1.51 above\n', b'the loss of $0.10 reported in 1996, excluding special charges. For the full year\n', b'of 1997, earnings per share (diluted) rose $3.78 from the loss of $2.37 reported\n', b'in 1996.\n', b'\n', b'1997 Highlights -- During 1997, the Company completed its restructuring program\n', b'and initiated a growth strategy that has generated consistent quarterly double\n', b'digit sales growth throughout the year. The company exited all its non-core\n', b'businesses in 1997, closed 18 factories, 43 warehouses and 5 headquarters,\n', b'reduced employment by approximately 50% (half of which reflects reductions\n', b'related to the disposition of non-core businesses) and substantially reduced its\n', b'SKU offerings as part of its restructuring program. Concurrent with the\n', b'restructuring program, the Company also implemented a three year growth plan to\n', b'strengthen the Sunbeam(R) and Oster(R) brand names and expand distribution\n', b"globally. Albert J. Dunlap, Sunbeam's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, said\n", b'"I am very proud of the dramatic turnaround that we have achieved at Sunbeam in\n', b'such a short period of time as we continue to execute against our three year\n', b'growth plans. Our continu ous sales increases of 13%, 17%, 28% and 31% in the\n', b'four quarters of 1997, for an overall sales increase of 22% for the year, are a\n', b'clear indication that our strategy is working."\n', b'\n', b"The Company's three year strategy to achieve $1 billion in revenue growth, which\n", b'it embarked upon in 1997, was fueled by the addition of 25 international\n', b'distribution/license agreements, the introduction of 35 new U.S. products and 54\n', b'new international products along with the contribu tion from 22 factory outlet\n', b'stores. "We experienced sales growth in all major channels of distri bution, in\n', b'all regions of the world and in each of our five global businesses, and we\n', b'gained market share in all of our key product categories, reversing a three year\n', b'downward trend, " said Mr. Dunlap. Sales to the Company\'s top 10 retailers were\n', b'up 15% and 22% in the latest quarter and\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'full year, respectively. International sales which are projected to contribute\n', b"40% of the Company's three year growth goal, were up 42%, and 34% for the\n", b'quarter and full year, respectively. Leading the sales growth internationally\n', b'was the Asia/Pacific region, up 425%, and the Latin American region, up 32%.\n', b'"The primary catalyst for this growth has been our ability to improve customer\n', b'service levels and introduce innovative and differentiated new products at an\n', b'accelerated pace. As part of the restructuring we implemented a new product\n', b'development process that has enabled us to reduce new product development time\n', b'from over 2 years to approximately 6 months," said Mr. Dunlap.\n', b'\n', b'"Equally as important as our strong top line growth was the remarkable\n', b'improvement in operating margins, year over year, and the continuous margin\n', b'expansion we delivered through-out the year. We set a three year goal to have\n', b'20% operating margins, and we were essentially at that level in the 3rd and 4th\n', b'quarters this year," said Mr. Dunlap. The Company\'s operating margins of 20% in\n', b'the 4th quarter and 17% for the full year reflect the numerous initiatives\n', b'associated with the restructuring program. "I am pleased with the pace of\n', b'improvements in our financial performance and expect continued margin\n', b'enhancement in 1998," Mr. Dunlap said.\n', b'\n', b'1998 Goals -- The Company announced its goals for 1998, which anticipate\n', b'increases in sales and margins at rates above those experienced in 1997. Mr.\n', b'Dunlap, commenting on the Company\'s 1998 revenue goals, said, "We have\n', b'established sales growth goals that should exceed the impres sive results\n', b'reported in 1997. In 1998 we will continue our global expansion with the\n', b'addition of 30 new global products, a dozen more international\n', b'distribution/license agreements and 10 more outlet stores. We expect to double\n', b'our media advertising spending to stimulate increased consumer pull for our\n', b'products and introduce new in-store merchandising programs to assist our retail\n', b'partners in the promotion and support of our aggressive growth goals." The\n', b'Company expects to introduce new products in 1998 that will strengthen its\n', b'global product lines, and market positions, by focusing on technological\n', b'innovation that satisfies chronic consumer needs.\n', b'\n', b"Commenting on the effect of the economic situation in Asia on the Company's\n", b'international growth plans, Mr. Dunlap stated, "Sunbeam has an advantage in that\n', b'we started from a very low base. Unlike other companies which have exported\n', b'heavily to Asia for years, we still have an ex cellent opportunity to build our\n', b'business rapidly in that region of the world. Our plans are to ini tially sell\n', b'our most highly differentiated products in Asia, like our electric blankets,\n', b'blenders, wa ter and air purifiers, hair clippers and ToastLogic(R) products.\n', b'Many of the products we will sell there can be sourced from Asian OEM\n', b'manufacturers, providing flexibility to enhance our growth opportunities in the\n', b'Asia/Pacific region."\n', b'\n', b'Mr. Dunlap said, "I am confident that we have the right initiatives in place to\n', b'achieve our goals and further expand operating margins in 1998." The Company\n', b'plans to increase the amount of out-sourcing in 1998 to help support its sales\n', b'growth objectives for the Asia/Pacific region and to allow for added capacity\n', b'without adding bricks and mortar to its existing 8 factories. "Currently our\n', b'make/buy composition is around 70/30 and I have set a goal for the Company to\n', b'source around 50% of its products and components by the end of 1998," said Mr.\n', b'Dunlap.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'Mr. Dunlap added, "I have always believed that a merger or acquisition unleashes\n', b'a quantum leap in creating shareholder value, and I am very eager to make this\n', b'strategic move in the first half of 1998. We continue to work towards finalizing\n', b'our plans for merging with, or acquiring, one or more companies that will\n', b'provide added value to all shareholders. We also remain open to a sale of the\n', b'Company if that would produce greater value for our shareholders."\n', b'\n', b'Sunbeam Corporation is a leading consumer products company that designs,\n', b'manufactures and markets, nationally and internationally, a diverse portfolio of\n', b"brand name products. The Com pany's Sunbeam(R) and Oster(R) brands have been\n", b'household names for generations, both domesti cally and abroad, and the Company\n', b'is a market leader in many of its product categories.\n', b'\n', b'CAUTIONARY STATEMENT: Statements contained in this press release, including\n', b"statements relating to the Company's expectations regarding anticipated\n", b'performance in the future, are all "forward looking statements" as such term is\n', b'defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. trademark/\n', b'\n', b'FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:\n', b'\n', b'       SUNBEAM ACQUIRES THREE PUBLICLY TRADED CONSUMER PRODUCTS COMPANIES:\n', b'                    COLEMAN, SIGNATURE BRANDS AND FIRST ALERT\n', b'                *****AL DUNLAP SIGNS NEW THREE YEAR CONTRACT*****\n', b'\n', b'DELRAY BEACH, FL, MARCH 2, 1998 - Sunbeam Corporation (NYSE: SOC) initiated an\n', b'aggressive expansion strategy today with the announcement of the acquisitions of\n', b'three separate market leading durable consumer product companies. These\n', b"transactions will enhance shareholder value by nearly tripling the Company's\n", b'annual revenues, expanding its geographic presence, complementing its existing\n', b'product lines and leveraging operational synergies. The three transactions will\n', b"total approximately $2.5 billion and will be meaningfully accretive to Sunbeam's\n", b'earnings within twelve months. The transactions are subject to regulatory\n', b'approvals and other customary conditions and are expected to close within the\n', b'next two months.\n', b'\n', b'The Coleman Company, Inc. (NYSE: CLN), with 1997 revenues of $1.1 billion is the\n', b'global leader in outdoor recreation and hardware products with powerful brands\n', b'such as Coleman/registered trademark/, Powermate/registered trademark/, Camping\n', b'Gaz/registered trademark/ and Eastpak/registered trademark/. The Company, based\n', b'in Wichita, KS, operates 17 manufacturing facilities and employs approximately\n', b'6,000 people around the world. The transaction is valued at approximately $2.0\n', b'billion, consisting of approximately $815 million in Sunbeam stock and the\n', b'balance in debt financing. Shareholders of The Coleman Company, Inc. will\n', b'receive $6.44 in cash and 0.5677 shares of Sunbeam stock for each share of\n', b'Coleman stock.\n', b'\n', b'Signature Brands USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: SIGB), with 1997 revenues of $279 million,\n', b'is the North American leader in coffee makers marketed under the Mr.\n', b'Coffee/registered trademark/ brand name and is a leader in consumer health\n', b'products marketed under the Health o meter/registered trademark/ brand. The\n', b'Company, based in Glenwillow, OH, operates two manufacturing facilities and\n', b'employs approximately 1,000 people. The transaction is valued at approximately\n', b'$250 million consisting of a cash tender offer of $8.25 per SIGB share and the\n', b'assumption of existing debt.\n', b'\n', b'First Alert, Inc. (NASDAQ: ALRT) with 1997 revenues of $187 million, is the\n', b'worldwide leader in residential safety equipment, including smoke and carbon\n', b'monoxide detectors. The Company, which is based in Aurora, IL, operates two\n', b'manufacturing facilities and employs approximately 2,100 people. The transaction\n', b'is valued at approximately $175 million consisting of a cash tender offer of\n', b'$5.25 per ALRT share and the assumption of existing debt.\n', b'\n', b'Albert J. Dunlap, Sunbeam\'s chairman and chief executive officer stated, "The\n', b'successful turnaround of Sunbeam, including the dramatic improvement of the\n', b'underlying business, has provided us with a solid platform for profitable\n', b'growth. These three separate transactions\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'                                     -more-\n', b'\n', b'Sunbeam\n', b'March 2, 1998\n', b'Page Two of Three\n', b'\n', b"represent the next phase of our plan to create value for Sunbeam's shareholders.\n", b'We looked at various alternatives to increase shareholder value. Ultimately we\n', b'decided there is phenomenal value to be created in assuming the leadership role\n', b'in consolidating the industries in which we compete. These acquisitions enable\n', b'us to accelerate our growth rate by expanding our geographic presence, entering\n', b'new product lines and leveraging the strength of dominant brand names such as\n', b'Coleman/registered trademark/, Camping Gaz/registered trademark/,\n', b'Eastpak/registered trademark/, First Alert/registered trademark/, Mr.\n', b'Coffee/registered trademark/, and Health o meter/registered trademark/, along\n', b'with Sunbeam/registered trademark/, Oster/registered trademark/ and\n', b'Grillmaster."\n', b'\n', b'Mr. Dunlap added, "Our strategy is to become the global leader in the durable\n', b'consumer products industry through continued internal growth augmented by\n', b'further strategic acquisitions of high quality consumer brands. Our proven track\n', b'record coupled with our financial strength will enable us to successfully\n', b'execute this strategy."\n', b'\n', b'The Company anticipates initial synergies of approximately $150 million which\n', b'will result in a substantial EPS accretion in 1999. A one time charge is\n', b'expected in 1998 in order to restructure and consolidate these three companies\n', b'into Sunbeam.\n', b'\n', b'Additionally, the Company announced that Chairman and Chief Executive Officer\n', b'Albert J. Dunlap, along with Executive Vice Presidents Russell A. Kersh and\n', b'David C. Fannin have all renewed their commitment to the Company by signing new\n', b'three year employment contracts. Mr. Kersh was named to the new position of vice\n', b'chairman of Sunbeam. Mr. Dunlap stated, "I am eager to continue to create\n', b'tremendous value for our shareholders by building the leading durable consumer\n', b'products company in the world. This new employment agreement will put to rest\n', b'any rumors that I would leave the Company."\n', b'\n', b'"This is a fantastic situation for all Sunbeam shareholders giving them the\n', b'opportunity to participate in the wealth that Al Dunlap and his team are\n', b'building," said Ronald O. Perelman, who will become Sunbeam\'s second largest\n', b'shareholder after the transaction. "Coleman will thrive as part of Sunbeam\'s\n', b'unbeatable family of brands," added Mr. Perelman.\n', b'\n', b'Michael Price, president and chief executive officer of Franklin Mutual Series\n', b"Fund, Sunbeam's largest shareholder, praised the transactions and new contracts.\n", b'"With the simultaneous acquisitions of these three publicly traded companies,\n', b'Sunbeam is launching into a bold new phase as the consolidator in its\n', b'industries," Mr. Price said. "Utilizing Al\'s unique ability to restructure and\n', b'reposition companies, the opportunities for operating synergies and incremental\n', b"sales growth is substantial. Al's renewed commitment indicates to me that the\n", b'best is yet to come for Sunbeam and its shareholders," Mr. Price added.\n', b'\n', b'\n', b'                                    -more-\n', b'\n', b'<PAGE>\n', b'\n', b'Sunbeam\n', b'March 2, 1998\n', b'Page Three of Three\n', b'\n', b'Morgan Stanley & Co.
